headlines: Kerala CM, his wife & daughter involved in gold smuggling: Main accused Swapna Suresh
text: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, on Tuesday claimed CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife Kamala and daughter Veena were involved in the scam. Suresh further said Vijayan's additional private secretary CM Raveendran, then Principal Secretary Nalini Netto and then minister KT Jaleel were also involved. "I've filed a petition seeking protection in the court," she added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Rajasthan BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal gets notice in 5-yr-old case
text: The Rajasthan Police has sent a notice to BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal in a five-year-old assault case. Meghwal, who represents the Keshoraipatan assembly constituency, has been asked to appear before the police to cooperate in the investigation. Meghwal is among the BJP MLAs who are camping at a resort in Jaipur ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJYM leader arrested in Kanpur for objectionable post on Prophet
text: Four days after violence broke out in UP's Kanpur, Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) leader Harshit Srivastava was arrested on Tuesday evening for his objectionable tweet on Prophet Muhammad. "We will act against anyone who tries to play with religious sentiments," said Kanpur Police Commissioner Vijay Meena. The police lodged a complaint as soon as the post surfaced online.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Raj Cong MLA accuses BJP, Subhash Chandra of horse-trading; seeks FIR
text: Rajasthan Congress MLA Mahendra Choudhary sought an FIR against BJP leaders, including state BJP president Satish Poonia, and independent candidate Subhash Chandra for alleged horse-trading attempts ahead of Rajya Sabha polls. BJP and Chandra are trying to win by misusing central agencies like ED, Choudhary alleged. This comes after Chandra claimed that eight MLAs will cross vote in his favour.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I've practically grown up in BJP, accept & respect its decision: Nupur on suspension
text: BJP's former National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from BJP over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, said she 'respects and accepts' the party's decision. "I have practically grown up in the organisation," said Sharma. At least 15 nations have condemned the remarks with some seeking a public apology over remarks by Sharma and another ex-BJP leader Naveen Jindal.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: We've nothing to hide: Pawan Khera on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
text: As ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, party leader Pawan Khera said the Congress has nothing to hide. "We're a law-abiding party...So, if they have been summoned, of course, they will go. We have nothing to hide," Khera added. Both the leaders have been summoned by the ED in connection with the National Herald case.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Action taken after Muslim countries protested: Owaisi on BJP leaders’ suspension
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that PM Narendra Modi took action against Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal only after Muslim countries raised their voices. "PM Modi took action after Muslim countries protested," Owaisi added. "We are angry that the PM (Narendra Modi) did not pay heed to the Muslims who are residents of this country," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: ED's recovery is proof of Satyendar Jain's honesty: BJP leader
text: Criticising Aam Aadmi Party and Satyendar Jain after ED raids, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said the recovery of ₹2.85 crore and 133 gold coins "is proof of Satyendar Jain's honesty". Poonawalla said, "CM Arvind Kejriwal who claims to be the most honest, has not yet been able to take the resignation of his Health-Minister-turned-hawalaat-minister."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Telangana BJP MLA booked for hurting religious sentiments
text: Telangana BJP MLA Raja Singh has been booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments of a community. He allegedly made derogatory remarks against Ajmer Sharif Dargah. The complainant, a resident of Hyderabad, said that a video of Singh making an offensive statement was viral on social media. The police said the authenticity of the video is yet to be confirmed.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Feel very happy: Nitin Gadkari as NHAI sets Guinness World Record
text: As the NHAI set a Guinness World Record by constructing a 75 km road in 105 hours and 33 minutes, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said it’s a proud moment for the entire nation. "Feel very happy to congratulate our exceptional team (at) NHAI," Gadkari added. The road was constructed in single lane on NH-53 section between Amravati and Akola .
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kejriwal mastermind of corruption: Manoj Tiwari on ED’s raid against Jain
text: After the ED found ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins on raiding Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide's premises, BJP leader Manoj Tiwari said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is the "mastermind" of this corruption. "The way Arvind Kejriwal is defending Satyendar Jain, I believe that Kejriwal is the mastermind of this corruption," Tiwari added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP releases candidate list for MLC polls in 3 states, KP Maurya fielded in UP
text: BJP has released a list of 16 candidates for the upcoming Legislative Council elections in three states - Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra and Bihar. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya, who lost the Assembly election from Sirathu seat, has been named in the list with eight other candidates for UP. Five candidates have been named for Maharashtra and two for Bihar.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Stop blaming us for your failure: RSS leader on Kerala CM's remark
text: RSS leader Indresh Kumar criticised Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan for his comments on former BJP leader Nupur Sharma's statement on Prophet Muhammad, saying he should be 'sued for hate speech'. "Pointing fingers at RSS is equivalent to spitting on the sun...the spit falls on your face," Kumar said. Political leaders should 'stop blaming RSS for their own failures', he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Chhattisgarh is ATM for Congress: BJP on mining at Hasdeo Aranya
text: Demanding Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo's resignation over the Hasdeo Aranya protests, BJP leader Brijmohan Agrawal criticised Congress and said, "Chhattisgarh is an ATM for the Congress." Agrawal further said that the ruling party 'did not care' about the people of the state. Tribals in Hasdeo Aranya have been protesting against mining inside the area for around 100 days.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Political agenda: Kerala CM on involvement in gold smuggling claim
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan denied the allegation of his involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case, saying it’s a part of the political agenda. His statement came after prime accused in the case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam. "There is not even an iota of facts in this allegation," Vijayan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nothing found at Satyendar Jain's house, BJP lying: AAP on ED's raid
text: AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said that nothing was found at Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain’s house during the raid conducted by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). "They (BJP) are lying…They spread fake rumours that cash and gold coins were recovered," Bharadwaj added. "The seizure memo of the ED raid was given to the wife and daughter of Satyendar Jain," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Focus on building organisation first: Nadda to Andhra BJP leaders
text: Addressing BJP leaders in Andhra Pradesh, party National President JP Nadda asked the leaders to first focus on building the organisation from the ground level in the state rather than worrying about political alliances. "Remember, we have BJP governments in 18 states, apart from the Centre...We have a strategy for Andhra Pradesh and will do whatever is required," Nadda said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Consider Marathi as optional language for UP students: Maha BJP leader to CM Yogi
text: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh requested UP CM Yogi Adityanath to consider Marathi as an optional language for the students of Secondary and Higher Secondary in UP. In a letter to UP CM, Singh wrote, "That may help students in getting better jobs in Maharashtra." "A big chunk of students…get migrated to Maharashtra for getting appropriate jobs," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will ensure justice for Sidhu Moosewala's family: Rahul Gandhi
text: Criticising AAP government over the law and order situation in Punjab, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said Congress will ensure justice to the family of Sidhu Moosewala. "It is difficult to express the pain experienced by the parents of Congress leader Sidhu Moosewalaji," he tweeted. Rahul Gandhi met the family of the late singer in Punjab's Mansa on Tuesday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP will work to end dynastic misrule in Telangana: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met BJP corporators in Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and other party leaders from Telangana. "We had wide-ranging discussions on how to focus on community service endeavours and help people at the grassroots," he said in a tweet. "BJP will work for good governance and ending dynastic misrule in Telangana," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Sonia Gandhi, suffering from COVID-19, seeks more time from ED
text: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has sought more time from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to appear for questioning as she has not yet recovered from COVID-19, reported PTI quoting sources. Gandhi had tested positive for the virus last Thursday. She and her son, Rahul Gandhi, have been summoned by the ED in connection with the National Herald case.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Such rhetoric will tarnish country’s image: Cong's Adhir on Prophet remarks
text: Following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said if such "rhetoric" is allowed in India, it will only "tarnish" the country's image. "Strict action should be taken against those responsible for tarnishing the country’s image. Do not try to save them by making excuses," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP carrying out 'cultural atrocity' via textbook revision: Shivakumar
text: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Tuesday accused the state government of carrying out 'cultural atrocity' through its textbook revision decision. "The BJP government has resorted to the cultural atrocity by twisting many great ideas, including Kuvempu in the children's revised textbook," Shivakumar alleged. He further stated that Congress will protest against the issue on June 9.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Does Kejriwal still think Jain is innocent?: Smriti Irani on ED’s seizure
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday asked Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal that does he still think Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain is "innocent"? Her statement came after the ED said it has found 133 gold coins and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of Jain and his aide.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Lalu Yadav fined ₹6,000 in 13-yr-old poll code violation case
text: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was fined ₹6,000 in a 13-year-old case related to model code violation by a court in Jharkhand's Palamu. During the 2009 Assembly elections campaign, Yadav's helicopter landed on a paddy field instead of the designated spot in Garhwa town where he was to address a rally. This was found in violation of the poll code.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Problematic in hierarchal organisations: Cong leader on CDS selection pool widening
text: Congress leader Manish Tewari said widening the pool for selection of CDS is not necessarily a bad idea but in "strictly regimented" and "hierarchal organisations" it may be problematic to put a retired officer over serving chiefs. The Centre issued three separate notifications amending the rules of the Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next CDS.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: SAD alleges threat to ex-minister Bikram Majithia's life in jail
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) on Tuesday alleged threat to the life of former minister Bikram Singh Majithia, who is lodged in the Patiala Central Jail in a drugs case. SAD leaders Maheshinder Singh Grewal and Dr Daljit Singh Cheema also alleged that there was a likelihood of Majithia being implicated in another "false" case. Majithia had surrendered on February 24.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi meets Sidhu Moosewala's family
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday met the family of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on May 29, at his village Moosa. Moosewala joined Congress in December 2021 and contested the 2022 Punjab Assembly elections from the Mansa constituency. "Deeply shocked...by the murder of promising Congress leader and talented artist, Sidhu Moosewala," Gandhi had tweeted earlier.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PM after AAP, but God's with us: Kejriwal on ED raids against Jain
text: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) found ₹2.85 crore in cash and gold coins weighing 1.8 kg after raiding Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aides' premises, CM Arvind Kejriwal said "The PM is after AAP with all his power." "You [PM] have the power of all the agencies, but God is with us," the AAP chief added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Magic show held for Rajasthan Cong MLAs in resort ahead of RS polls
text: A magic show was organised for Rajasthan Congress MLAs who are staying in a resort amid poaching fears ahead of the June 10 Rajya Sabha polls. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot was also present there during the show held on Monday. The Congress had shifted its legislators to Udaipur on June 2.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: 133 gold coins, ₹2.8cr cash found in raid on Delhi minister & his aide; pics released
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has found 133 gold coins weighing 1.8 kg and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of arrested Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide. The seized cash and gold were acquired from unexplained sources, ED said. Various incriminating documents and digital records were also found, it added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: RSS workers start 'chaddi' campaign after K'taka Congress' 'burn-the-chaddi' campaign
text: After Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah asked party workers to start 'burn-the-chaddi' campaign, RSS workers launched a house-to-house collection drive for "chaddis" to send them to Congress leaders' homes. Congress students' wing NSUI were seen setting fire to a pair of khaki knickers, which are associated with RSS, in their protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Chaddis do chaddi work: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah on RSS
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised RSS saying "chaddis do chaddi work" and asked why the post of the organisation's chief has never been occupied by a Dalit. "I am telling you from the beginning that RSS is a non-secular organisation," he said. Siddaramaiah is talking about such things because he doesn't have any other subject, said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: India became global superpower in last 8 yrs under PM Modi: Harsh Vardhan
text: PM Modi has transformed India from a third-world country into a global superpower in the last eight years, said former Union Minister Harsh Vardhan. "It's only because of [PM's] people-centric policies that people have renewed their faith in democracy," Vardhan said on Tuesday. He further claimed that India is well poised to become the world's third-largest economy by 2030.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: YSRCP hires I-PAC again ahead of 2024 Andhra Assembly polls
text: Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSRCP has hired political strategist Prashant Kishor's Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) for a second time ahead of 2024 state Assembly polls, a party leader has confirmed. "Kishor's colleague...Rishi Raj Singh [along with I-PAC's team] will be working for...YSRCP till...next elections," the leader added. YSRCP won 151 out of 175 seats in 2019 state Assembly polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Not important: Kerala Guv on Qatar's demand for apology over Prophet remarks
text: As Qatar sought the Indian government’s apology over former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said that "it is not important". "People are entitled to their opinions. How does it matter? That (demand for apology) is not important," Khan added. "India cannot bother about such small reactions," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sena MLAs moved to unknown hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls on June 10
text: Shiv Sena has moved a group of its MLAs and some independent candidates to an unknown hotel ahead of the Maharashtra Rajya Sabha polls for six seats. The move is a preventive measure to dismiss any possibility of horse-trading by the BJP ahead of the polls. Sena has nominated Sanjay Raut and Sanjay Pawar for the Rajya Sabha polls.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Tripura CM Manik Saha holds door-to-door campaign ahead of bypolls
text: Tripura CM Manik Saha held a door-to-door campaign on Tuesday ahead of Assembly bypolls in the state. Saha, who replaced ex-CM Biplab Kumar Deb last month, is contesting bypolls from the Town Bardowali constituency and filed his nomination papers on June 6. Bypolls to Town Bardowali, Agartala, Surma and Jubarajnagar are scheduled to be held on June 23.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Take action against those spreading hate: Vijayan on remarks against Prophet
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday urged the Centre to take action against those "propagating hate and trying to destroy the secular fabric of our country." "Sangh Parivar forces have brought our country...to a state of embarrassment in front of the world," he added. Vijayan's remarks came after several countries condemned ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Not afraid: Mamata on terrorist group KLO chief's reported threats
text: After banned terrorist group Kamatapur Liberation Organization (KLO) chief reportedly threatened West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee with a "bloodbath" if she opposed the group's demand for a separate state, she responded by saying, "Some people are threatening me, I'm not afraid." In a purported video message to Banerjee, KLO chief had said, "Beware. Don't step on the soil of Kamatapur."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP govt made 'mockery of plight of unemployed Goans': AAP leader
text: The Aam Aadmi Party leaders have criticised BJP-led Goa government for backtracking on its promise of employing youths in government jobs. Goa AAP Vice-President Surel Tilve alleged the government has made a "mockery of the plight of unemployed Goans". This came after CM Sawant reportedly said that the government is in a position to employ only about 8,000-10,000 more people.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Kashmiri Pandits had to migrate twice when BJP was in power: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has criticised BJP over targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits in Jammu and Kashmir, claiming, "In the last 30 years, Kashmiri Pandits had to migrate twice and both happened when BJP was in power." He called the killings a "massacre". Last week, Kashmiri Pandits held protests and threatened mass migration over targeted killings in the valley.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Done to please foreign leaders: Owaisi on suspension of BJP leaders
text: Following BJP's move to suspend Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said it was done to "please leaders of foreign countries". "This issue had become big in the Gulf countries, so under compulsion, PM of the country took action against his national spokesperson," Owaisi added. "You want to please the leaders of foreign countries," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: India doesn’t need lecture from any nation on religious tolerance: Cong leader
text: Following ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress' Jaiveer Shergill said India doesn't need a lecture from any nation on religious tolerance. "BJP must realise that our secular identity shouldn't be dented for cheap political gains and TRP sensationalism...India's identity as vibrant, multi cultural habitat must stay forever!" Shergill tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong burning RSS chaddi as theirs has been stripped: Pralhad Joshi
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said Congress is "burning RSS chaddi (knicker)...because people have stripped [Congress'] chaddis". This comes after Congress' youth wing NSUI set fire to a pair of RSS knickers to protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks in Karnataka. People have taken Congress' chaddis off in front of the entire country in Uttar Pradesh, Joshi added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: K'taka BJP will face 2023 polls under collective leadership: Yediyurappa
text: BJP leader and former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Tuesday said the 2023 Assembly elections in the state will be fought under 'collective leadership'. "As voters are with PM Narendra Modi and...BJP, there will be no hurdles in our path towards victory," he said. Yediyurappa added that he is committed to travelling across the state to strengthen the party.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Will shed my blood but never allow division of Bengal: CM Mamata
text: Amid demands for a separate state carved out of West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said she's ready to shed her blood but will never allow a division of the state. "With elections approaching, BJP is fanning the demands of separate statehood, sometimes seeking Gorkhaland and at other times a separate state of North Bengal," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Candle flares bright before burning out: J&K LG on targeted killings
text: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said religious leaders and the people of Kashmir are condemning the targeted killings of civilians in the Valley. "When a candle is about to burn out, its flame flares bright. This (militancy) is taking its last gasps," Sinha added. "They are unable to digest the arrival of so many tourists to the Valley," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: UP CM wants to create state where people feel safe: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Ashok Bajpai said CM Yogi Adityanath has made constant efforts against criminals in UP. "CM wants to create a state where the rule of law will prevail and people of every society feel safe and secure," Bajpai added. Action is being taken against criminals at district level so that UP can become a crime-free state, he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Prophet remarks not made by any govt functionary, no impact on govt: Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said that remarks against Prophet Muhammad by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma do not have any impact on the government. "I don't think that this statement was made by any government functionary and therefore it has no impact on the government and necessary action has been taken by the party," Goyal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rajasthan BJP MLAs shifted to resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
text: The BJP shifted most of its MLAs in Rajasthan to a resort in the outskirts of Jaipur. This comes ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for four seats from the state, scheduled for June 10. Calling it a training camp, a party spokesperson said that the MLAs will be given training on the Rajya Sabha elections.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Congress aims to politicise textbook issue: K’taka Education Minister
text: Amid the textbook issue in the state, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said Congress aims to "politicise" the textbook issue for elections. "For the last 65 years, they were teaching false things to the students," Nagesh added. "Congress, everyday, is coming down. Whatever false agenda they have given to the people, it is coming out now," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kerala govt should take responsibility for lack of cleanliness in Kochi: Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said Kochi is lagging in cleanliness and state government along with local bodies should take responsibility for it. "I also love Kochi. But...I don't love it when in...short span of time it falls from fifth rank to 324 in the swachhta index," Goyal said. The minister is on a two-day visit to Kerala.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: MVA leaders should contact us for support in RS polls: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said no one from the ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in Maharashtra has asked them for support in the upcoming elections to six Rajya Sabha seats. "If they want our support, they should contact us," Owaisi added. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena MLC Ambadas Danve said MVA leaders will soon decide on Owaisi's proposal.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: WB cabinet passes bill to make Mamata Chancellor of state-run universities
text: The West Bengal cabinet on Monday approved a proposal to make Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee Chancellor of all state-run universities under different departments like Health, Agriculture, Animal Husbandry and Minority Affairs. According to officials, the CM is going to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar, who currently holds the post. The decision will be taken up for approval in the state Assembly.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Those who express bigotry should be aware of consequences: Tharoor on Nupur's remarks
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said, "Those who express bigotry at home should be aware of the consequences abroad." He was reacting to reports claiming that superstores in Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and Bahrain removed Indian products over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. India's proud position is being undermined by the irresponsibility of the communal-minded, he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Hindi is language of underdeveloped states, will make us 'Shudras': TN MP
text: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan has alleged that attempts were being made to "impose Manu dharma through the imposition of Hindi", adding that Hindi is the language of underdeveloped states. "What will Hindi do? Only make us Shudras. It will do no benefit to us," he added. Several leaders criticised the DMK leader over his remarks.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: AAP is the only antidote to BJP: Kejriwal at 'Tiranga Yatra' in Gujarat
text: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal held a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Gujarat's Mehsana on Monday, ahead of the state Assembly elections. "People are scared to say anything against BJP. AAP is the only antidote...Gujarat wants change," Kejriwal added. AAP will be contesting the polls on all 182 seats in the state.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: An error, statement made under provocation: Jethmalani on Nupur’s remarks
text: Reacting to former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jethmalani said it was an "insensitive statement made under provocation", which she has regretted. "The real fringe are those who on public platforms stoke fire created by her error and ruin GoI's efforts to repair the damage and restore India's image abroad," he tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: ED raids on Satyendra Jain are an act of torture: Sanjay Singh
text: AAP MP Sanjay Singh has criticised the Enforcement Directorate raids at Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain's residence. "This is an act of torture, not an act of raid because Jain has been questioned for five days. He is an honest person," Singh said. "Whatever Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal said today is the training of the BJP itself," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP pushed India into dark age of religious polarisation: Congress
text: A day after Gulf countries condemned now suspended BJP spokesperson's remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Congress said that "the BJP has pushed India into a dark age of religious polarisation". It said that the BJP's statement, saying it is against any ideology which insults any religion, is farce and a sham attempt at damage control.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Centre calling ex-BJP leaders 'fringe elements' is a joke: Cong MP
text: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh reacted to the Centre's response to Qatar and Kuwait demanding an apology over a former BJP spokesperson's remark on Prophet Muhammad, saying that the External Affairs Ministry "calling (former) BJP spokespersons 'fringe elements' is a joke". Moreover, he stated that BJP suspending Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal "is what Americans call a good cop-bad cop routine".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Delhi Cong passes resolution to make Rahul Gandhi as party's national president
text: The Delhi unit of the Congress party has unanimously passed a resolution requesting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to become the party's national president. "In these challenging times, only a strong leader like Rahul Gandhi...can further strengthen and rejuvenate the Congress, to expose the lies and falsehood of BJP and AAP," the resolution said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Rahul Gandhi to meet Moosewala's family in Mansa on Tuesday
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will meet the late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family in the latter's native village in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday. Notably, this will be Gandhi's first meeting with the family since Moosewala's assassination. Gandhi had condoled on the demise of the 28-year-old singer-turned politician who was shot dead by assailants last month.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP leaders trained in 'hate politics' by PM Modi: AAP's Sanjay Singh
text: AAP leader Sanjay Singh said in 75 years, no one has "bowed India's head in shame" as much as PM Narendra Modi. "BJP leaders and spokespersons make mistakes because they're trained in hate politics by PM Modi and the whole country bears the consequences," Singh added. His remarks came a day after BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Making law for population control won't serve any purpose: Bihar CM
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said making a law for population control won't serve any purpose. "Population control can only be achieved by educating women and girls. The fertility rate can be checked only through education and awareness," Kumar added. He cited China's instance where one-child policy was in effect for many years. "It has now changed...to two-child policy," Kumar stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why should India apologise for hate speeches of BJP bigots: KTR
text: A day after BJP suspended two spokespersons, Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal, over remarks on Prophet Muhammad amid condemnation by Gulf countries, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the party, not the country, should apologise. "PM Narendra Modi Ji, why should India as a country apologise to international community for the hate speeches of BJP bigots?" he tweeted.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: No rule of law in state, only a ruler: WB Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said he has seen a situation where there is no rule of law in the state but a "ruler". "I've seen terrible situations and challenges being a Governor. I've seen the rule going beyond the constitutional system," Dhankhar added. Furthermore, Dhankhar said the rule in West Bengal doesn't match the standards of a democratic setup.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why no arrest has been made yet?: Owaisi over Nupur Sharma's remarks
text: Following Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked, "Why there is still no arrest against the spokesperson (now suspended)?" He added that instant action is taken when someone speaks or tweets against PM Narendra Modi but no action has been taken against Sharma who "insulted Prophet Muhammad".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Atmosphere of threat being propagated in state: Pilot on Moosewala’s death
text: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday met late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala’s family in Mansa. "It's tragic how our leader was killed. An atmosphere of threat is being propagated in state repetitively," Pilot said. "The Centre and state government should probe it (death) and take strict action," he stated. "Such an incident happened to instil fear in people," Pilot added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Entry of Hindi has divided people in south: TN MP on 'Shudra' remark
text: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan, who earlier stated that Hindi imposition will denote Tamilians as 'Shudras', stated that "entry of" Hindi has divided people in southern India. "What I [meant] was that [usage of] Hindi...may bring...cultural practice...enforced in the north to us...It'll confirm our Shudra class," he said. Elangovan had earlier claimed that Hindi is spoken in "underdeveloped states".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: The way BJP is working, country heading towards civil war: Lalu Yadav
text: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav on Sunday said that the way BJP is working, the country is moving towards a "civil war". "I call upon the people to unite against inflation, unemployment and corruption in the country," Yadav added. "We've to fight united and we'll win…We do not have to back off," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi has weakened environmental laws in India: Jairam Ramesh
text: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has accused PM Narendra Modi of weakening environmental and forest laws in India. "Vishguru is launching LiFE (Lifestyle for Environment)," Ramesh said. "This is maximum hypocrisy since he's (PM Modi) weakening all environmental and forest laws, regulations, and institutions at home while posing as an eco-champion on the world stage," Ramesh added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Should be in Limca Book of Records: Sule over raids on 'Deshmukh family'
text: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh have not done anything but are "stuck" in jail, NCP MP Supriya Sule said. "109 times raid on Deshmukh family should make it to Limca Book of Records," Sule added. "Today or tomorrow, the court will give them a clean chit. Whoever speaks against the Centre is raided," Sule stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Suspension not enough, send them to jail: Mayawati after BJP expels members
text: A day after BJP members Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal were suspended over remarks hurting religious sentiments, BSP chief Mayawati called for their arrest. "Only suspension is not enough, they must be jailed under strict laws," she wrote on Twitter. She said that objectionable language should not be used against any religion and the BJP must rein in its members.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: What has Kejriwal done for Kashmiri Pandits in Delhi?: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday asked, "What has Arvind Kejriwal (Delhi CM and AAP national convenor) done for Kashmiri Pandits in Delhi?" His statement came after Kejriwal said BJP can’t handle Kashmir. "He does not believe in the atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits and takes support from Khalistani supporters to form a government in Punjab," Thakur added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Political alliances can't be one-sided: Milind Deora on BMC wards reservation
text: After 21 of the 29 wards held by Congress were reserved for women for the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation election, Congress leader Milind Deora has expressed his disappointment. "The greatest casualty of BMC's ward reservation has been Congress, despite being an MVA ally. Political alliances cannot be one-sided. I will raise this issue...with the party's leadership," Deora said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: A lot of heat in TV studios, no major riots in past 10 yrs in India: Sadhguru
text: There is "a lot of heat" in television studios which suggests there is rising religious intolerance in country, Sadhguru said. He added, we haven't heard of any major communal riots in India in past 10 years. "These things have come down significantly in last 25 years," Sadhguru said. "I think we tend to exaggerate things quite a bit," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Saddened, says Ex-Tripura Governor as BJP suspends Nupur Sharma
text: After BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma, former Governor of Tripura Tathagata Roy said he is “saddened” over the “treatment” of Sharma. “I am now an ordinary member and supporter of BJP...I have nothing to fear or expect from the BJP,” Roy added. “I support BJP because it is the closest to my thinking,” Roy stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP's bigotry damaged India's position: Rahul on Prophet remark row
text: Rahul Gandhi on Monday criticised BJP for its "shameless bigotry" amid the Prophet remark row, stating that BJP has not only isolated India but also damaged its global position. He added that India's internal division had weakened country externally. Gandhi's remarks came as countries including Qatar and Kuwait summoned Indian envoys over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's comments on Prophet Muhammad.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Christianity being spread across Punjab to weaken Sikhs: Akal Takht Jathedar
text: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Monday said Christianity is being spread across villages of Punjab to weaken Sikhs. "Sikhs are facing a lot of difficulties that are making us weak religiously, socially and economically," he added. "I appeal to all Sikhs, especially those in border areas to spread and strengthen Sikhism," Singh stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Who is Nupur Sharma, whose remarks made 3 nations call Indian envoys?
text: Former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma is a graduate in economics from Delhi University's Hindu College and also studied LLB from DU before completing her Master's degree in law from the London School of Economics. In 2008, she won the post of Delhi University Students' Union President. In 2015 Delhi Assembly election, she lost to Arvind Kejriwal from New Delhi constituency.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I withdraw my statement: Nupur as BJP suspends her for remarks on Prophet Muhammad
text: Nupur Sharma retracted her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, made during a TV debate on the Gyanvapi issue, after being suspended by the BJP on Sunday. "I have been attending TV debates for the past many days where our Mahadev was being insulted and disrespected continuously...I couldn't tolerate this continuous insult...and said some things in response to it," said Sharma.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: We denounce insult of religious personalities: BJP after its leader's remarks on Prophet
text: After violence broke out in Uttar Pradesh over BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, the party released a statement saying, "BJP strongly denounces insult of any religious personalities of any religion." "The BJP is also strongly against any ideology which insults or demeans any sect or religion. The BJP does not promote such people or philosophy," it added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: BJP suspends Nupur Sharma after her remarks on Prophet Muhammad
text: BJP has suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma from the party after her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate. The party has also suspended Delhi BJP's media in-charge Naveen Kumar Jindal. Notably, violence broke out in Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh on Friday after a Muslim organisation gave a call to shut shops over remarks made by Sharma.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What did you do about Delhi's law & order in last 10 days: Atishi asks L-G
text: AAP MLA Atishi has accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena of "interfering" in the Delhi government's work and "conspiring" to derail democracy. "Today I want to ask him 'What have you done to improve the law and order situation in Delhi in the last 10 days?'," Atishi added. "L-G is acting like a dummy of the...central government," she said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: There's threat to my family: Nupur as her address is made public in BJP suspension letter
text: After being suspended from BJP amid controversy over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Nupur Sharma tweeted, "I request all media houses and everybody else not to make my address public. There is a security threat to my family." This comes after her suspension letter, which consisted of her address, was shared by various media houses and journalists.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Raghav Chadha says 'Send officers to tribal affairs as punishment posting'; criticised
text: In an interview, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "You can't fire government officials. You can only transfer them. If someone is working very well, you'll give them a good department...And if someone is doing a bad job, send them to tribal affairs as punishment posting." "I'm ashamed that I ever saw hope in youngsters like Raghav Chadha," said Yogendra Yadav.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP leader shares video, claims MLA's son involved in case of minor's gangrape in Hyd
text: BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao has shared a video alleging that an AIMIM MLA's son is involved in the case of a minor's gangrape in Hyderabad. Police had said that the MLA's son was not present at the time of the alleged crime. Meanwhile, Inspector S Rajashekhar Reddy said four accused have been arrested while the fifth accused is absconding.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: You've respected me as a sister: Kangana on CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th b'day
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared a post for UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kangana shared a photo of him and wrote, "An eminent leader and a source of inspiration. Someone who has always loved and respected me as a sister. Praying for Yogi's long life and [I] hope his glory shine throughout this world."
author: Mahima Kharbanda

headlines: Situation in Kashmir is deeply concerning: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Speaking about the recent killings in Kashmir, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray called the situation in the valley "deeply concerning". He said, "It is unfortunate that the situation is repeating in these times again. We expect the Government of India to take strong measures to ensure their protection." Kashmir has reportedly witnessed at least eight killings since May 1, 2022.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Won't quit Cong, up to them to throw me out: Sunil Jakhar's nephew
text: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar's nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar has said that he'll not resign from his post and if Congress wants to "throw [him] out, it's up to them". This comes after Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Sunil to make Sandeep quit as MLA and join BJP. The remark shows Congress leadership's "arrogance", Sandeep added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Will summons in name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?: Shiv Sena
text: After ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' asked, "Will a few summons in the name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?" "In the National Herald case, the transaction was done to repay the loan and not for misconduct...Nehru started this newspaper in the year 1937," Shiv Sena added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre in denial, wants everyone to pretend all is well in J&K: Farooq
text: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said the central government is living in "denial" and it wants everyone to keep their heads down and pretend all is well in Kashmir, including Kashmiri Pandits. Speaking about the recent incidents of violence in the Valley, Abdullah said, "They (central government) want to project normalcy to the world when it is the exact opposite."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP becoming 'Cong-yukt': AAP after 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
text: AAP on Sunday said BJP which used to talk about a "Congress-mukt Bharat (Congress-free India)" is itself becoming "Congress-yukt (filled with Congress)". This comes a day after four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP. AAP leader Malvinder Singh Kang also accused BJP of double standards, stating that it welcomed many Congress leaders against whom it had levelled several charges earlier.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We've some people in TMC who pass on information to us: WB BJP chief
text: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said his party has some people in TMC who pass on information to them. "In fact, every party plants its men in other parties to remain privy to crucial decisions taken by its political opponents," he added. Reacting to his remark, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "No one believes what he (Majumdar) says now."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Satyendar Jain can't have lawyer during ED questioning: Delhi HC
text: The Delhi High Court stayed a trial court order that allowed Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain to have his lawyer present during the questioning by ED in a money laundering case. The HC noted that since there is no FIR against Jain and he has only been called for questioning, he cannot claim the right to have his lawyer present.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Dynamic CM: PM Modi on UP CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th birthday
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday wished UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday and called him a "dynamic CM". "Under his able leadership, the state has scaled new heights of progress. He has ensured pro-people governance to the people of the state," PM Modi tweeted. "Praying for his long and healthy life in service of the people," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Not necessary to meet him every time: Chavan on 'haven’t met Rahul in 4 yrs'
text: Ex-Maharashtra CM and Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan has issued a clarification over his remark "haven’t met Rahul Gandhi in the last four years." "He had resigned from his post in the organisation…He’s opposing PM Narendra Modi in his own way and going across the nation and abroad. Not necessary to meet him every time," the Congress G-23 group member added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Maharashtra will do whatever is possible for Kashmiri Pandits: CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that his government will do whatever is possible for Kashmiri Pandits. "We will not leave them in the lurch," Thackeray added. "Maharashtra will stand firmly with them," he stated. Meanwhile, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray, CM’s son, said that the situation in Kashmir is "deeply concerning".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: CEC Rajiv Kumar treks 18 km to remote polling booths in U'khand
text: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar trekked for 18 kilometres on Friday to the remote polling booths of Uttarakhand to assess the challenges faced by polling parties in hilly areas. Kumar visited Dhumak and Kalgoth, the most remote polling booths of Uttarakhand located in Chamoli. "Polling parties have to walk three days to reach here," Kumar said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Shiv Sena to put up MLAs at Mumbai hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
text: In a bid to avoid poaching, Shiv Sena has asked all its MLAs to stay at a hotel in Mumbai ahead of the Rajya Sabha elections, which will conclude on June 10. The decision was taken "as a precautionary measure", a senior party leader said. "They have been told to come to Mumbai on June 8," the leader added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Sunil Jakhar should make nephew quit as MLA, join BJP: Punjab Cong chief
text: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Indian Express that if BJP leader Sunil Jakhar feels that he is a "big and popular leader", then he should make his nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar quit his post and join BJP. However, Warring claimed that Sunil would not do so because he knows that "Sandeep will lose the bypoll".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: It is a trouble-engine not double-engine govt in Bihar: Tejashwi
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday criticised CM Nitish Kumar-led NDA government in Bihar, saying, "Some...say it's a double-engine government in Bihar. But it's a trouble-engine government."  In Bihar, inflation is high, farmers are in "distress" and "no one talks about labourers and unemployment", he claimed. RJD is the only regional party that hasn't "compromised" with BJP, he also claimed.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Enough of high-level meetings, Kashmir wants action: Kejriwal
text: Following targeted killings in Kashmir, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that the era of 1990 has come again. "Whenever there is a murder in the Valley, news comes that the Home Minister has called a high-level meeting, enough of these meetings, now we need action, Kashmir wants action," Kejriwal added. "They (government) don't have any plans," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress appoints observers for 3 states ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
text: Congress on Sunday appointed senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Pawan Kumar Bansal, TS Singh Deo, Bhupesh Baghel and Rajeev Shukla as its central observers ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.  Kharge has been appointed observer in Maharashtra, Bansal and Deo in Rajasthan and Baghel and Shukla in Haryana. These leaders will take the responsibility with immediate effect.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Kashmir is burning but important people of Delhi promoting films: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that Kashmir is "burning" again and the situation there is out of control. "Important people of Delhi (central government) are busy promoting films," Raut added. "No one is willing to listen to the Kashmiris. The Kashmiri Pandits are forced to agitate, what is the government doing?" Raut asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tip of iceberg: Former CM as 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
text: After four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP on Saturday, ex-Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said, "This is just the tip of the iceberg!" His remark came as Balbir Singh Sidhu, Raj Kumar Verka, Sunder Sham Arora and Gurpreet Singh Kangar joined the BJP in Chandigarh in Union Home Minister Amit Shah’s presence, yesterday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Pushkar Singh Dhami wins Champawat bypolls, to remain Uttarakhand CM
text: BJP leader Pushkar Singh Dhami on Friday won the Champawat bypolls by over 55,000 votes and he will now continue to remain the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand. He defeated Congress' Nirmala Gahotri, SP candidate Manoj Kumar and independent candidate Himanshu Garkoti. PM Narendra Modi congratulated Dhami and said, "I'm confident he will work even harder for the progress of Uttarakhand."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 4 former Punjab Congress ministers join BJP in Amit Shah's presence
text: Former Punjab Congress ministers Balbir Singh Sidhu, Raj Kumar Verka, Sunder Sham Arora and Gurpreet Singh Kangar joined the BJP in Chandigarh on Saturday in Home Minister Amit Shah's presence. Former Congress leader KS Dhillon and former SAD MLA SC Singla are also reportedly set to join BJP. State Congress chief ASR Warring called the switchovers "a blessing in disguise".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: AAP to contest on all 182 seats in upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls
text: Ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections, Delhi Deputy CM and AAP leader Manish Sisodia announced that the party will be contesting the polls on all 182 seats in the state. "Till now, the people of Gujarat didn't have an option, but now they have one," he said in Vadodara. AAP had made its debut in Gujarat in the 2017 Assembly polls.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: All Odisha ministers resign ahead of Cabinet reshuffle
text: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday asked all Cabinet ministers to resign ahead of a reshuffle on June 5. The new Council of Ministers will reportedly take oath on Sunday. The reshuffle exercise began a day after the ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) won three Rajya Sabha seats unopposed and the bypoll in the Brajrajnagar Assembly constituency.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 'Assam CM gave PPE contracts to his wife's firm', says Delhi Dy CM; he responds
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has alleged that Assam CM Himanta Sarma gave contracts for PPE kits to firms owned by his wife and his son's business associates. He alleged Assam government bought PPE kits at inflated prices from these firms. Sarma refuted these allegations saying his wife donated free PPE kits. "You'll face criminal defamation," said Sarma to Sisodia.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Gujarat Congress leader whose wife caught him with woman takes break from politics
text: After his wife caught him with a woman, ex-Union minister and Gujarat Congress leader Bharatsinh Solanki announced that he would be taking a break from politics for a few months. "We have not lived together for many years," the Congress leader said about his wife. He added that his wife had even contacted an exorcist to take his life.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: BJP govt in Gujarat ashamed of its schools: Manish Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM and AAP leader Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP government in Gujarat and said the state government was "ashamed" of its schools. "As part of the conference (National Conference of School Education), Education Ministers from other states were supposed to see the Gujarat Model," Sisodia said. He questioned why the ministers were not shown a single government school.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Our govt achieved in 8 yrs what others couldn't in 60 yrs: Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said the government has achieved in the past eight years what the previous government could not achieve in 60 years. "The Union Government under PM Narendra Modi has been able to sow seeds of development in the remotest corners of India," Thakur said. The gap between the rich and the poor has decreased, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Victory for Lalu ji: Tejashwi Yadav on caste-based survey in Bihar
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav called the approval of a caste-based survey in Bihar a victory for the former CM and his father Lalu Prasad Yadav as well as the people of Bihar. "This has been our cause from the beginning," Yadav said. The government has allocated a budget of ₹500 crore for the survey.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong should see why experienced leaders are leaving: Sunil Jakhar
text: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar criticised Congress and said the party "should see why such experienced leaders and workers are leaving the party". "If they can't pledge their allegiance to the country and remove the drawbacks of the party, they might even lose the status of being an Opposition," Jakhar said. His comment comes after six Punjab Congress leaders joined BJP.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Take action by rising above religion, caste: Mayawati over Kanpur violence
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday, while reacting to the violence in Kanpur, urged the UP government to take action "by rising above religion, caste and party politics". "Government has to understand that in...absence of law and order, how investment and development are possible in the state?" Mayawati tweeted. Notably, three people including a police officer were injured in the violence.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong doesn't recognise workers: Punjab ex-minister on joining BJP
text: Former Punjab minister Balbir Singh Sidhu criticised Congress after he joined BJP and said Congress does not 'recognise its workers'. "I have been in Congress since I was 30-32 years old...(I've) worked with all my blood and sweat for the party," he said. Sidhu, along with three former Congress ministers and two SAD leaders joined BJP on Saturday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Old tactic to disown unpopular things: Owaisi on RSS chief's 'Shivling' remark
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday criticised RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's Gyanvapi mosque speech, calling it "incendiary". Moreover, following Bhagwat's "Shivling" remark, Owaisi said that it's an "old Sangh tactic to disown things when they're unpopular". He also questioned "assurance" given by Bhagwat and BJP chief JP Nadda over the issue, adding that they both "hold no constitutional posts".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Bihar govt will take suggestion on caste census: Nitish Kumar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has said that the state government will take "suggestions" from all political parties on the caste-based census which will be conducted by the state. "Decisions have been made on caste-based census and the department is already preparing for it. We'll keep informing parties about it and take suggestions from them," CM Nitish said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: ₹300 cr in Guj MLAs' Local Area Development funds remains unspent: ADR
text: More than ₹300 crore in the MLA Local Area Development (MLALAD) funds remains unspent in Gujarat, according to a report released by NGO Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). "The unspent amount...will expire once the Assembly term ends," it said. Of the ₹1,004 crore worth of development works, projects worth ₹677.5 crore had been completed by March this year, it claimed.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Delhi govt does less work, more publicity: MoS Education Annapurna Devi
text: Minister of State for Education Annapurna Devi accused Delhi government of doing less work and more publicity in the education sector. "Instead of running...for votes, you should focus on providing quality education," she said. Her comments came after Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia said the National Achievement Survey (NAS) must not turn into a high-stakes exam.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Next CM will be from NCP: Maharashtra Minister Dhananjay Munde
text: Maharashtra Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde said, "Next CM will be from NCP and I will continue to hold the Social Justice Department." "NCP chief...made me the Leader of Opposition in state council between 2014 and 2019...and I [did[ justice to the post," he added. Supriya Sule earlier said, "Let the next CM of Maharashtra be from NCP."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Congress misusing power to win Rajya Sabha polls: Vasundhara Raje
text: BJP leader and former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Thursday accused the Congress government of misusing power to win elections for four Rajya Sabha seats in the state. Her comments came after Congress MLAs were lodged in hotels amid fears of poaching. "A police vehicle has been placed behind every MLA. This is a complete abuse of power," Raje added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: No improvement in Kashmir despite abrogation of Article 370: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the recent killing of a bank manager, identified as Vijay Kumar, by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam. "You (BJP) talked about the return of Kashmiri Pandits and fetched votes in the name of Hindutva. There is no improvement in people's lives despite the abrogation of Article 370," Raut said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Govt wants to get me killed to break Tikait family: Rakesh Tikait
text: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait has alleged that the government "wants to get him killed to break the Tikait family". Tikait termed the recent ink attack on him in Bengaluru a "well-planned conspiracy".  "People who raise their voices for the country and the farmers of the country are on the target of the conspirators," the farmer leader said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Had Sardar Patel not acted, India's map wouldn't be the same: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said India would have had a different map if Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel had not taken police action. "Entire country is indebted to Sardar Patel for liberating us from the tyrannical rule of the Nizams," Shah said at an event to celebrate Telangana Formation Day. He further accused Telangana CM KCR of not cooperating with Centre.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Haven't met Rahul Gandhi in 4 years: Congress' Prithviraj Chavan
text: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister and Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan said he has not been able to meet senior leader Rahul Gandhi in the last four years. "There was no 'chintan' or introspection at the recent Congress conclave," he said. There's a complaint that the party leadership is not as accessible as it should be, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Action against those responsible for Visakhapatnam gas leak: Chandrababu Naidu
text: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has said that "action should be taken" against those responsible for the recent gas leak incident in a Visakhapatnam-based laboratory in which around 200 workers fell ill. "The failure of the government departments and absence of monitoring has become a curse for the public," Naidu said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Provide security to Hindu community in J&K: Shiv Sena MP to Centre
text: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah urging him to provide adequate security to the Hindu community in Kashmir immediately. "Such targeted attacks...raise questions on the implementation of [govt] schemes...for the development and rehabilitation of Kashmiri migrants," she wrote. Chaturvedi's letter comes a day after a bank employee was shot dead in Kulgam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: I'm in favour of a strong opposition in country: PM Modi
text: Addressing an event at President Ram Nath Kovind's ancestral Paraunkh village in UP, PM Narendra Modi said that he is in favour of a strong opposition. Dynastic politics is throttling talent in the country, he added. Dynastic politics must stop so that anyone born in a village can become the PM and the President, he further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Citizenship Amendment Act will not be implemented in Kerala: CM Vijayan
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday said that his government would not implement the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in the state. "The government has a clear position on CAA. That will continue," he added. "No one here has the authority to determine citizenship on the basis of religion," Vijayan stated. "Nowadays, attempts are being made to destroy secularism," he added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Mamata inaugurated railway bridge without inviting Railways Minister: BJP MLA
text: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday inaugurated a railway bridge in Hooghly, BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari criticised the move claiming that she hadn't invited Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw or any railway authorities. Eastern Railway had spent "lion's share" for the bridge, he alleged. Earlier, Eastern Railway wrote to the state government about not being informed about the event.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Former Congress leader Hardik Patel joins BJP
text: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who recently quit Congress, joined BJP on Thursday. Before joining BJP, Patel tweeted, "I will work as a small soldier under the leadership of the PM Narendra Modi." He added, "With the feelings of national interest, state interest, public interest and social interest, I am going to start a new chapter from today."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: After Satyendar Jain, Manish Sisodia to be arrested soon in fake cases: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said in a press conference, "Reliable sources have suggested to me that Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon. Centre has ordered all agencies to form fake cases against him." He added, "I'd already announced a few months back that central government is going to arrest Satyendar Jain in a fake case."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sonia Gandhi tests COVID-19 +ve before ED appearance in money laundering case
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said, "She has developed mild fever and some symptoms and has isolated herself." He added, "As of today, her date of appearance before the Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is." The ED summoned Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Haryana Congress MLAs taken to Chhattisgarh resort amid poaching fears
text: Haryana Congress on Thursday shifted its MLAs to a resort in Naya Raipur, Chhattisgarh amid fears of poaching ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls. Buses carrying the MLAs were seen arriving at the Mayfair resort amid heavy police deployment. Party MP Deepender Singh Hooda had earlier said, "No MLA is upset...All MLAs will go to Chhattisgarh."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Request PM to jail all AAP MLAs at once, not 1 at a time: Kejriwal
text: Days after Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest, CM Arvind Kejriwal, in an apparent dig, asked PM Narendra Modi to jail all ministers and MLAs from AAP at one go. "Ask all central agencies to do all investigations at one go…Do as many raids as you want. You arrest one minister at a time, it obstructs public work," said Kejriwal.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Wish you a speedy recovery: PM Modi to Sonia Gandhi after she tests COVID-19 positive
text: After Congress announced that the party's interim President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Wishing Congress President Smt Sonia Gandhi Ji a speedy recovery from COVID-19." Congress said that she developed mild symptoms and has isolated herself, adding, "As of today, her date of appearance before Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: It’s our duty to watch film on Savarkar: Shiv Sena leader
text: Ahead of the upcoming movie 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', Shiv Sena leader Bharatshet Gogawale said Veer Savarkar is the pride of our nation and his work is legendary. "I feel it's our duty to watch a film that praised him and his work," Gogawale added. "A film on Savarkar is an excellent thing for all Hindus in this country," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why Kejriwal didn't take action against Satyendar Jain: Smriti Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani asked why Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal didn't take any action against Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain, who has been arrested in an alleged money laundering case. "For how long he will protect a desh ka gaddar (traitor), who...deceived the treasury," Irani said. She also asked if Kejriwal was associated with Jain, "who...laundered  ₹16.39 crore through shell companies".
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: T'gana suffered extreme 'misgovernance' by TRS in last 8 yrs: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, on the occasion of Telangana Formation Day, said the state was born out of people's aspirations for a better future. "In the last eight years, Telangana...suffered extreme misgovernance by TRS," Rahul added. He further reaffirmed Congress' commitment to build Telangana into a model state, ensuring prosperity for all, including farmers, poor and common people.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Those who should protect Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting film: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said those who should be protecting Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting a film (The Kashmir Files). Referring to the targeted killings in Kashmir, Gandhi said, "Bank manager, teacher and many other innocent people are being killed everyday, Kashmiri Pandits are fleeing." "Take immediate steps to restore peace in Kashmir, Prime Minister ji," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No minister of ruling AAP visited Moosewala’s family: Congress leader
text: Days after Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead, Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa on Wednesday said that no MP or minister of the ruling AAP visited the singer’s house and stood by the family. "CM Bhagwant Mann Ji is this what you meant when you said 'Our government will be for aam aadmi?'" Bajwa tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: KK felt unwell, wanted to leave but wasn't allowed: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
text: Following singer KK’s demise in Kolkata, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh on Thursday said the singer was "forced to sing despite complaining of uneasiness". "He was feeling unwell and sweating. He wanted to leave but was not allowed. He was murdered," Ghosh added. Meanwhile, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "It's BJP’s culture to engage in such cheap and ugly politics over death."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Modi government is behaving worse than Congress: AIADMK
text: The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) organisational secretary C Ponnaiyan criticised its ally BJP saying PM Narendra Modi-led government at the Centre is behaving worse than Congress. Calling BJP anti-Tamil, Ponnaiyan said, "Tamil Nadu should be given an exemption in language policy." He further alleged that the BJP is continuously "imposing" Hindi despite AIADMK's opposition.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Workers, not politicians' children, will get preference in polls: Nadda
text: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday said the party will give preference to workers over children or family members of politicians in upcoming polls. "In Uttar Pradesh...children of many lawmakers were competent. Similar may be the case in MP. But we have to follow a policy," Nadda said. "We are against politics of dynasty," he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Assam govt very clear that no Muslim man should marry 3 women: CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state government is very clear about certain things like no Muslim man should marry three women. "Don’t give talaq, give divorce legally. An equal share of the property should be given to daughters like sons," Sarma added. "Views of the government and the common Muslims are the same," Sarma stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ahmednagar should be renamed as Ahilyanagar: BJP leader to Maha CM
text: BJP leader Gopichand Padalkar has written a letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray demanding that Ahmednagar should be renamed as Ahilyanagar. "She reconstructed temples that were destroyed by Muslim rulers. Thus, Ahmednagar should be renamed, as a tribute to her, as Ahilyanagar," Padalkar wrote. "Hindurajmata Punyashlok Ahilyadevi Holkar is an inspiration for Hindustan," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Several problems will be solved if PM Modi drops his ego: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that several problems in the country will be solved if PM Narendra Modi drops his ego. "If the ego is set aside, then many issues plaguing society...will be solved. Someone should convey this to PM," he added. "Only one message of Gautam Buddha should be kept in mind...that is to leave ego," Raut stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Heartbreaking, mind-numbing: Omar on bank manager’s killing in J&K
text: After a bank manager from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Kulgam, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Thursday said it’s heartbreaking to see families destroyed like this. "Tweeting to condemn an attack and condole a death are becoming a mind-numbingly regular thing," Abdullah said. "Yet another targeted killing!" he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Conspiracy theorist: Smriti on Kejriwal's 'Sisodia to be arrested' claim
text: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said as per reliable sources AAP's Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon in "fake cases", Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "Conspiracy theorist strikes back!" "It would be easier to come out ‘clean’ for once instead of peddling fake sob stories which do not have any takers anymore," Irani tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: He's becoming Paigambar: CPI (M) leader on Assam CM's Muslim marriages remark
text: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Thursday criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma for his remark on Muslim marriages. "Assam CM is becoming the Paigambar (religious leader), not Chief Minister. Every day he's giving advice on different religions," he said. Sarma had recently said his government is clear that no Muslim man should marry three women.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Jinnah, Nehru divided country as act of wisdom: Congress leader
text: Congress leader Sajjan Singh Verma said that Muhammad Ali Jinnah and ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru "divided the country as an act of wisdom". "Jinnah was a freedom fighter and this should be remembered. He did not break the country but did the right thing," he added. "Does the definition of freedom fighter change because of one being a Muslim?" he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP loves to weaponise pain of Kashmiri Pandits: PDP
text: The BJP loves to weaponise the pain of the Kashmiri Pandits, said the PDP in its monthly newsletter 'Speak Up' on Tuesday. Referring to the recent killing of a government official, Rahul Bhat, the article titled 'The Saffron Trojan Horse' said, "Kashmiri Pandits get teargassed by the police for protesting [against] the killing of Rahul Bhat."
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: AAP leaders visiting Moosewala’s parents discretely: Punjab Congress
text: The Punjab Congress on Thursday said that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders have started "shedding crocodile tears" for late singer Sidhu Moosewala by paying a "discrete visit" to his parents, away from the public gaze. "Backdoor condolences!" Punjab Congress tweeted. Furthermore, the party said that the ruling AAP exposed Moosewala like a "sitting duck".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi's support to Sri Lanka's Rajapaksas was wrong: AIADMK
text: AIADMK organisational secretary C Ponnaiyan has criticised the BJP-led Centre, calling its policies "anti-Tamil". He also questioned the Centre's support to Sri Lanka's Rajapaksa family. "[PM] Narendra Modi government's support to Rajapaksas was wrong. India should have been supporting Sri Lankan Tamils instead," said Ponnaiyan. He also accused the Centre of stealing Tamil Nadu's revenue.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Congress will come down to 30-35 seats in 2024 polls: Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that it will be difficult for the Congress party to retain the status of the principal Opposition party in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "As per my assessment, they will come down to around 30-35 seats in 2024," Sarma added. Furthermore, Sarma said that the party treats all states with contempt.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will work as small soldier under PM Modi: Hardik Patel ahead of joining BJP
text: Ahead of joining BJP on Thursday, Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel said he is going to start a new chapter in his life with the feelings of national, state, public and social interests. "I will work as a small soldier in the noble service of the nation under the successful leadership of PM Narendra Modi," Patel tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Money laundering without money: Chidambaram on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul
text: As ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, party leader P Chidambaram said money laundering without money is like alleging purse snatching without a purse. “It’s like alleging that you were found swimming without authorisation in pool that had no water,” Chidambaram tweeted. “You can think of more examples (each one more absurd than the other),” Chidambaram added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Not my job to question about policies: Akshay Kumar on asking PM Modi if he eats mangoes
text: Speaking about interviewing Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Akshay Kumar said, "As a common man, I just wanted to ask him very simple, straight questions." On being questioned about asking PM Modi if he eats mangoes during the interview, the actor said, "It's not my job to ask about the policies...It all looks fake if I would do that."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi summoned by ED in alleged money laundering case
text: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case related to National Herald, which was closed in 2015. "The BJP is using puppet agencies to intimidate political opponents," Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said. "All companies do improve balance sheet by turning loans into equities," Singhvi added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP to hold national executive meeting in Hyderabad on July 2 & 3
text: The BJP will hold its national executive meeting in Hyderabad on July 2 and 3. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah, BJP chief JP Nadda and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh are among the leaders who will attend the two-day event. It is the key decision making body of the BJP.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Modi govt now blind in fire of revenge: Cong on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul
text: After ED issued summons to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and party leader Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case, Congress said, "The Modi government has now turned blind in the fire of revenge." Party spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said, "They're experts in the politics of deviating from real issues." The alleged money laundering case is related to National Herald.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Extremely irresponsible: BJP leader on TN Minister's COVID-19 remark
text: Uttar Pradesh Minister and BJP leader Jitin Prasada criticised Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian's remarks, calling it "extremely irresponsible and derogatory". "Disease and pandemics do not know any state boundaries or borders as we have all experienced," Prasada tweeted. His tweet came after Ma Subramanian blamed North Indian students for COVID-19 spread in Tamil Nadu.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Central govt selling PSUs, implementing anti-labour laws: TRS leader
text: TRS leader and Telangana MLC K Kavitha on Tuesday criticised BJP-led central government while accusing it of selling the Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs). Kavitha also accused the Centre of implementing "anti-labour laws" alleging that the Modi government has "duped" public with reforms carried out in its eight years of tenure. "TRS government is fighting against such laws (reforms)," she added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Raj Thackeray's hip surgery postponed after he tests COVID-19 +ve
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray's hip surgery, which was scheduled to take place on Wednesday, has been postponed after he tested positive for COVID-19. Thackeray, who is suffering from avascular necrosis, was admitted to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital for undergoing hip replacement surgery. The surgery has been put on hold until his COVID-19 test returns negative.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: PM, this isn’t a movie, it’s reality of Kashmir today: Rahul on teacher’s killing
text: A day after a Kashmiri Pandit teacher was shot dead by terrorists in J&K, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that Kashmiri Pandits are protesting for the past 18 days but BJP is busy celebrating eight years of government.
