"Prime Minister, this is not a film, it is the reality of Kashmir today," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP not letting central govt schemes reach Punjab's people: Hardeep Puri
text: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said the central government has started several welfare schemes which are benefitting people across the country. However, the Aam Aadmi Party government in Punjab is not allowing those schemes to reach common people, Puri said. He added that people in Punjab are being denied the benefits that can be availed from central government.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP worked to make 8 years of Modi govt unmatchable: JP Nadda
text: BJP National President JP Nadda said that the party has worked to make the eight years of PM Narendra Modi-led government unmatchable. This, he said, includes service, good governance and welfare of the poor. Addressing party workers in Bhopal, Nadda said, "Let us make our work universal and inclusive, let's work to reach out to all sections of the society."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: PM Modi’s Shimla visit a failed attempt to allay fear of defeat: Congress
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh called PM Modi's Shimla visit a failed attempt to allay fear of defeat. She said the state government spent crores on his rally but he left people disappointed as he didn't announce anything for them. Instead of interacting with beneficiaries of government schemes, PM Modi should've talked to people affected by unemployment, she added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: TRS govt didn't build houses for poor as promised in T'gana: Kishan Reddy
text: Union Tourism Minister G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday alleged that the TRS government in Telangana did not build houses for the poor as promised. "In Telangana, the government said 'we will build double bedroom houses only and not any 'dabba' houses.' Eight years have passed. Houses have not been built for the poor so far," Reddy said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Gujarat Congress MLA detained for holding rally without police nod
text: Congress MLA from Gujarat's Vansda, Anant Patel, was detained for holding a rally in Navsari without police permission on Tuesday. Patel addressed the contractual workers of Gujarat Energy Transmission Corporation (GETCO), who have been demanding their salaries to be increased. The MLA has warned of staging a protest seeking the suspension of Local Crime Branch (LCB) Police Inspector.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Govt agencies do their work: Anurag Thakur on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
text: Soon after ED summoned Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the government agencies do their work. They have been summoned in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to National Herald. Meanwhile, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said BJP is using "puppet agencies" to intimidate political opponents.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ever seen criminal say I'm criminal?: Nadda on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
text: Soon after ED summoned Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, BJP chief JP Nadda asked, "Have you ever seen a criminal say I'm a criminal?" Nadda added, "They (Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi) will of course deny it. Documents are proof." They have been summoned in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to National Herald.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kashmir essential part of PM Modi's New India journey: Union Minister
text: Kashmir is an essential part of PM Narendra Modi's New India journey, said Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh on Tuesday at a public gathering in Budgam. Singh attended the "Garib Kalyan Sammelan" that was virtually addressed by PM Modi from Shimla. Singh distributed certificates related to Mudra Yojana, Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana and other welfare schemes on the occasion.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Ram Mandir will be national temple of India, symbol of country's unity: UP CM
text: The Ram Mandir being built in Ayodhya will be the "national temple of India", UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Wednesday. CM Yogi laid the foundation stone for Ram Mandir's Garbhagriha in Ayodhya today. "People have been waiting for this day for a long time. Ram Mandir will be a symbol of India's unity," CM Yogi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nobody paid heed to Sikhs’ requirements for 70 years: JP Nadda
text: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday said that for 70 years no one paid heed to the requirements of Sikhs. "The task of connecting India with Pakistan via the Kartarpur corridor was undertaken by PM Narendra Modi at a cost of ₹120 crore," Nadda added while addressing devotees at Gurudwara Nanak Tekri in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress leader Brijesh Kalappa resigns, cites lack of passion
text: Senior Congress leader and Supreme Court advocate Brijesh Kalappa has resigned from the party. In a letter to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, Kalappa said, "I have been representing the party on Hindi, English and Kannada channels since the UPA years in 2013." "But, in the recent past, I have been finding myself lacking in passion," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Not the time to lose hope: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra to Cong workers
text: Speaking at the 'Nav Sankalp Shivir' in Lucknow, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra told party workers that "this is not the time to lose hope". Lauding workers' fight in the recent polls, she said, "Entire country saw how (Uttar Pradesh) Congress workers, leaders fought. At Udaipur Shivir many told me that they were inspired by the way...Congress workers fought."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: TN transformed into Eden of Peace: CM Stalin on opposition's law & order remark
text: Rejecting the charge of opposition parties that law and order in Tamil Nadu have deteriorated, Chief Minister MK Stalin said that the situation in the state is stable and peaceful. "There are no caste or communal clashes," Stalin claimed. "Due to effective administration...crimes have been kept under check and the state has transformed into an Eden of Peace," he said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: TN BJP chief booked for protesting against fuel prices without permission
text: A case has been registered against state BJP chief K Annamalai and over 5,000 people for protesting and marching towards the state's Secretariat in Chennai without permission, demanding the government to reduce fuel prices, police officials said. "DMK promised in its manifesto that it will reduce the prices of petrol and diesel by ₹5 and ₹4 respectively," Annamalai added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Jharkhand govt orders probe into BJP leaders' 'disproportionate assets'
text: The Jharkhand government ordered a probe into the alleged disproportionate assets of five former ministers of the previous BJP government. This comes after a plea was filed in Jharkhand High Court against the leaders - Amar Bauri, Nilkanth Singh Munda, Neera Yadav, Randhir Singh and Lois Marandi. Their assets grew by up to 1200% in five years, claimed the petition.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Satyendar Jain is patriot, should be given Padma Vibhushan: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said Delhi minister Satyendar Jain is a patriot and he should be given "Padma Vibhushan". "Country should be proud of him, he gave Mohalla Clinic's model to Delhi. People from across the world come to see it," Kejriwal added. "Let everyone enquire...CBI has already cleared him, ED will as well," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Country facing wheat crisis due to BJP's faulty economic policies: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged that the country is facing a crisis in wheat supply due to faulty economic policies of BJP-led central government. She further criticised the Centre for demonetisation and demanded that financial dues of the state be cleared. "If you can't pay...money to states, you have no right to govern this country," Mamata added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AAP’s Sanjay Singh demands Eshwarappa’s arrest for 'insulting national flag'
text: AAP leader Sanjay Singh has demanded that BJP leader and ex-Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa should be arrested for "insulting the national flag". This comes after Eshwarappa said RSS flag "will become the national flag someday". "For more than 50 years, the national flag was not hoisted at RSS headquarters. Actually, the BJP is opposed to the national flag," Singh said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: What BJP is doing isn't expected, stop politicising KK's death: TMC
text: After BJP and Congress demanded an impartial probe into singer KK's death in Kolkata, TMC state General Secretary Kunal Ghosh asked the parties to not politicise his death. "What BJP is doing isn't...expected. [It] should stop its vulture brand of politics," he said. The TMC leader added, "We won't be astonished if BJP starts claiming...KK was their party leader."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Gyanvapi is a masjid & will remain so: Owaisi as survey pics leaked
text: After videos and pictures of the Gyanvapi mosque survey were leaked, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the footage which was being broadcasted on TV channels "could be doctored". "Even if it's genuine, Gyanvapi was a masjid...and will remain a masjid," he added. "Even Supreme Court judges have said that such details shouldn't be played in media," the AIMIM chief said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP leadership warns Dilip Ghosh for criticising Bengal party leaders
text: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh has been criticised by the party's central leadership for speaking against a section of party leaders in West Bengal. "There have been some avoidable instances when some of your statements or outbursts have...caused embarrassment to the central leadership," BJP National General Secretary Arun Singh wrote in a letter, as per BJP National President JP Nadda's instructions.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Delhi court summons Congress' Shivakumar in money laundering case
text: A Delhi court has summoned Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar in a money laundering case after taking cognisance of a chargesheet filed by ED. The court has directed him to appear before it on July 1. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Cong expresses displeasure over J'khand's RS poll nominee pick
text: Congress has expressed displeasure after coalition partner Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) picked its senior leader Mahua Maji as the candidate for upcoming Rajya Sabha polls from Jharkhand. Congress is upset over the "unilateral" move, state Congress in-charge Avinash Pande said. Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren, however, stated that the decision was taken after talks with Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP-led central government 'adulterated', destroying economy: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called the BJP-led central government "adulterated" and accused it of mismanaging country's economy. "They've destroyed...country's economy through disastrous decisions like demonetisation. It was a big scam," she said while addressing a meeting of TMC workers in Purulia district on Tuesday. She added that BJP is trying to silence opposition through central agencies.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Demonetisation caused harm, people won't forget: Rahul to PM Modi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said people will never forget the pain of demonetisation. In a Facebook post, Gandhi said the demonetisation exercise, introduced by PM Narendra Modi's government in 2016, was done "deliberately so that lakhs of crores of loans of 'Modi-friend' capitalists can be waived" off. Many died while waiting in line for money, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 8 BJP candidates from UP file nomination for Rajya Sabha elections
text: Eight BJP candidates from Uttar Pradesh filed their nominations for the Rajya Sabha elections on Tuesday. Those who filed their nominations included BJP's OBC Morcha national president K Laxman and ex-BJP state president Laxmikant Vajpayee. UP CM Yogi Adityanath, who was also present on the occasion, said, "Hearty congratulations...to all the respected candidates...Victory is sure for all of you."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Another home irreparably damaged by violence: Omar on J&K teacher’s killing
text: After a Kashmiri Pandit teacher was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said that another home has been irreparably damaged by violence. "She lost her life in a despicable targeted attack," Abdullah tweeted. The deceased woman, 36-year-old Rajni Bala, was a resident of Samba in Jammu region.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi: Smriti Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday alleged that the Gandhi family did politics from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi for decades, but kept the constituency's people "poor". "The Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi," she claimed. Furthermore, she alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had "left for Kerala in 2019" as he knew Amethi's people had "resentment" against the Gandhi family.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: India's borders more secure than they were before 2014: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the country's borders have become more secure than they were before 2014. He said, "Before 2014, there was concern about the security of the country, today we're proud of the surgical strike-air strike." PM Modi said this while addressing a rally in Shimla to mark the eighth anniversary of BJP government at the centre.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Congress spoiled my winning streak, won't work with them: Kishor
text: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said on Monday that he won't work with Congress as the party spoiled his track record. "From 2011-2021, I was associated with 11 elections and lost only one election that's with...Congress in UP," he said. Kishor refused to join Congress in April, citing need for "leadership and collective will to fix structural problems" in party.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Before 2014, talks were on scams, 'atki, latki, bhatki' schemes: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday claimed that before 2014, talks used to be about things like scams, corruption, nepotism and "atki, latki, bhatki (stuck, hanging, derailed)" schemes. "But today talks are about benefits from govt schemes," he said. PM Modi made the remarks while addressing a meeting in Shimla as BJP-led government marks eight years at the Centre.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: There will be 'no entry' for BJP in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that no matter how much the BJP tries there will be "no entry" for the party in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "There are no chances of the BJP returning to power," she said. "The citizens of the country are fed up with the anti-people government at the Centre," she further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Not much difference: UP CM after Akhilesh said a child called him Rahul Gandhi
text: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claim that a child called him Rahul Gandhi when he was the CM, the current UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that there is not much difference between the two. "The only little difference is that Rahul Gandhi criticises India in foreign countries, while you (Akhilesh) do the same for UP when outside the state," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India wants job security, not 'racial purity': Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said the country wants job security and economic prosperity, not "racial purity". Reacting to a news report on Culture Ministry's plan to study "racial purity", Gandhi said, "The last time a country had a culture ministry studying 'racial purity', it didn't end well." The Culture Ministry called the news report "mischievous and misleading".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Maha Congress leader quits post over 'outsider' pick for RS polls
text: Congress' Ashish Deshmukh on Tuesday resigned as General Secretary of Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee amid disappointment over the party's decision to nominate "outsider" Imran Pratapgarhi from Maharashtra in Rajya Sabha polls. "Imposing an outside candidate will not benefit the party...This is injustice towards...Congress workers in Maharashtra," Deshmukh said. Pratapgarhi hails from UP.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP uses CBI, ED for its political vendetta against people: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday accused the BJP of using CBI and Enforcement Directorate (ED) against people for its political vendetta. Addressing the party workers at Purulia, she said, "[The] central agencies should first arrest the corrupt BJP leaders." "Try whatever you want to, in 2024 (Lok Sabha elections), there will be no entry for BJP," she added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP will do horse-trading and spoil atmosphere: Gehlot on RS polls
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that BJP will do horse-trading in the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections and spoil atmosphere of the state. "BJP fielded Subhash Chandra. They know they don't have sufficient votes so what will they do," he added. Randeep Singh Surjewala, Mukul Wasnik, and Pramod Tiwari have filed nominations as Congress candidates for Rajya Sabha polls from Rajasthan.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP is afraid of Congress party's ideology: P Chidambaram
text: On being asked whether the BJP-led Union government is afraid of him, senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said the BJP is afraid of his party's ideology and not him. He said, "I'm not a tiger...to be afraid of...I'm an ordinary human being, reflecting the Congress." "I don't think they are afraid of me…they fear the Congress party's ideology," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Nirmala Sitharaman files nomination for Rajya Sabha from Karnataka
text: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman filed her nomination for Rajya Sabha elections as BJP candidate from Karnataka's Vidhana Soudha (Legislative Assembly). Prior to filing the nomination, Sitharaman visited the Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple in Bengaluru. Sitharaman thanked Karnataka BJP leaders for supporting her nomination and said that she will dedicate herself to serving Karnataka.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Youth Congress holds protest in Delhi demanding justice for Moosewala
text: Indian Youth Congress on Tuesday held a candlelight march in Delhi to demand justice for Punjabi singer-Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's death. Indian Youth Congress President Srinivas BV said, "(AAP chief) Arvind Kejriwal got one chance [in Punjab Assembly elections]. Who'll give one chance to Sidhu Moosewala?...Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann are responsible for Moosewala's death."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: He has got all these opportunities: CM Nitish on not sending RCP Singh to RS
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar commented on his party JD(U)'s decision to not field Union Minister RCP Singh for the next month's Rajya Sabha biennial election. "He (RCP) has been sent to RS twice. He was also made JD(U) President and he is currently a minister in the Central government. So he has got all these opportunities," CM Nitish Kumar said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: AAP, Cong create propaganda, defame ED: BJP MP on Satyendar Jain's arrest
text: BJP MP Jugal Lokhandwala on Monday said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and Congress "deliberately create propaganda to defame the Enforcement Directorate (ED)". His comments came after AAP claimed that party leader Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in a "fake case". "The ED is doing its work...this is your political stunt, it's not going to work," Jugal added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Assam govt delivers 1st instalment of PMAY to 15,000 beneficiaries
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday handed over the first instalment of ₹32,500 each of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) to around 15,000 beneficiaries of Sivasagar and Charaideo districts. "The government wants all sections of...society, regardless of their social strata, to be adequately served so that no one stays out of...reach of the government's welfare measures," Sarma said.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: People in power in Odisha jealous of PM Modi: Dharmendra Pradhan
text: Speaking in Odisha's Podamarai, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said that people in power in Odisha are "increasingly jealous of PM Narendra Modi". He added, on the contrary, Odisha's support for the PM is growing. "There is no dearth of funds for the infrastructure and development of the people of Odisha, but is misused...by the government here," he said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: 18 lakh homes to be built in K'taka under PMAY in 3 yrs: CM Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that over 18 lakh homes will be constructed in the state under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) in the next three years. "PMAY aims at ensuring a roof over the head for each family in the country," he said. Bommai also lauded PM Narendra Modi's several initiatives for the welfare of the marginalised sections.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP workers march towards TN Secretariat over tax on fuel prices
text: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai and party workers marched towards the state's Secretariat in Chennai in a protest over DMK-led state government not reducing tax on fuel prices on Tuesday. DMK promised to reduce the petrol and diesel prices "by ₹5 and ₹4 respectively" in its manifesto, Annamalai said. "We demand...state government to fulfil what it's promised," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Hardik Patel to join BJP on June 2 after quitting Congress
text: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who recently quit Congress, confirmed to ANI that he will join BJP on June 2. In his resignation letter, Patel had said, "Be it the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, revocation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, implementation of GST - India wanted solutions...Congress only played the role of roadblock." Patel joined Congress in 2019.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Lawrence Bishnoi moves court fearing encounter by Punjab Police in Moosewala murder
text: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's one of the prime suspects in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, moved an NIA court on Monday fearing a fake encounter by Punjab Police. Bishnoi is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail and has sought to stop Punjab Police from gaining his custody. The court, however, refused to entertain his plea.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Why did Enforcement Directorate arrest Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain?
text: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Monday in an alleged money laundering case. The agency alleged that Jain was involved in hawala transactions with a Kolkata-based firm in 2015-16. Earlier, the CBI alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Once, a child called me Rahul Gandhi: Akhilesh in UP Assembly
text: Samajwadi Party leader Akhilesh Yadav on Monday narrated an incident in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly from the time when he was the Chief Minister. "I asked a child if he knew who I was. The child said, 'Yes, you are Rahul Gandhi'," he said. Several leaders in the Assembly laughed over this.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Satyendar Jain arrested in 8-yr-old fake case as BJP losing in Himachal: AAP
text: AAP MP Sanjay Singh on Monday, while reacting to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest in a money laundering case, claimed the arrest was made because BJP is "losing in Himachal Pradesh". Singh claimed Jain was arrested in an "eight-year-old fake case" and was being "harassed". "BJP do not contest elections, they run away from elections," Singh added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Personally studied ED case against Satyendar, it's fake: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that he's "personally studied" the Enforcement Directorate (ED) money laundering case against AAP leader Satyendar Jain and it's "completely fake". "We neither tolerate corruption nor [do we do] corruption. We've a very honest government," he added. Kejriwal also gave the example of AAP-led Punjab government dismissing its minister over corruption charges.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Satyendar Jain arrested in fake case, to be out soon: Manish Sisodia
text: AAP's Manish Sisodia said Delhi minister Satyendar Jain, who was arrested by ED in alleged money laundering case, will be out soon as the case is "totally fake". "ED had stopped calling him for some time...Now, it has again started calling him because he is the (AAP) incharge of the Himachal polls," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Black ink, deadly attack can't suppress farmers' voices: Tikait
text: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait, who was attacked with black ink during a press conference in Bengaluru on Monday, said that black ink and deadly attack cannot suppress the voice of farmers, labourers, Dalits, the exploited, backwards and tribals of this country. "The fight will continue till the last breath," the farmer leader said in a tweet.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong leader criticises Jairam going door-to-door to give invites; he responds
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh criticised state CM Jairam Thakur for going door-to-door to invite people to 'Garib Kalyan Sammelan' programme, saying that his actions were "below the dignity of the CM". Thakur responded to Singh's remark, saying that he's a "common man" and questioned how he'd lowered his dignity. The programme will be held in Shimla.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Subhash Chandra files nomination from Rajasthan for Rajya Sabha polls
text: Rajya Sabha MP and Zee TV's Founder Subhash Chandra filed his nomination for Rajya Sabha elections as an independent candidate on Tuesday. Chandra's candidature has been backed by BJP and he also met ex-Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje during his visit to the state. Chandra's tenure as a Rajya Sabha MP from Haryana will end on August 1.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: After not being fielded for RS, Naqvi likely to contest LS polls: Report
text: Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi is likely to be fielded by the BJP for the Lok Sabha bypolls from the Rampur constituency, ANI reported. Notably, Naqvi, whose Rajya Sabha tenure is going to end in July 2022, has not been listed by the BJP as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha biennial election scheduled for June 10.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Mann doesn't deserve to remain CM: SAD leaders to Punjab Governor
text: A day after Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leaders met Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit to seek the dismissal of CM Bhagwant Mann. "[Mann] is pushing [Punjab] back into...anarchy. We also demand NIA probe into...killing," SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted. Punjab government will set up a judicial commission to probe Moosewala's death.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP creates controversies, you stay silent: Abhishek Banerjee to WB Guv
text: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Monday accused West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of remaining silent when BJP leaders make controversial statements and insult CM Mamata Banerjee. His comments came after Dhankhar accused Abhishek Banerjee of "crossing the red line" by criticising judiciary. Banerjee claimed that BJP leaders Dilip Ghosh, Biplab Deb and others have also criticised the judiciary.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Voting to decide U'khand CM Dhami's fate underway in Champawat
text: Voting for the by-election to Champawat Assembly seat in Uttarakhand is underway which will decide the fate of CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who had lost from the Khatima seat during state elections. "A new history of Champawat will be created today by 100 per cent voting," Dhami said. The counting of votes will take place on June 3.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Attack on Tikait exposed BJP’s intellectual bankruptcy: Ex-K’taka CM
text: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Monday condemned the physical assault on Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait in Bengaluru and stated that the incident has "exposed BJP's intellectual bankruptcy". "Assault on...Tikait is a testimony to BJP's inability to face opponents on ideological basis," Siddaramaiah tweeted. Tikait was attacked with black ink at a press meet in the city today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: If speaking against Savarkar is anti-national then put me in jail: Cong leader
text: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said if speaking against Veer Savarkar is anti-national, then he should be put in jail. "BJP is saying that if anyone speaks against Veer Savarkar then he is an anti-national. Yes, I am saying I am speaking against him. If I am anti-national, arrest me and put me behind bars," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: High inflation, financial mismanagement synonymous with Modi govt's 8 yrs: TMC
text: The Trinamool Congress criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government, which completed its eight years on Monday, and said that mismanagement of economy and high inflation have been "synonymous" with eight years of Modi regime at Centre. TMC further said that Modi government has "failed on all fronts" and added that the Constitution is constantly "undermined" and "disregarded" in PM Modi's regime.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Biplab Deb's removal as CM proves BJP govt is non-performing: TMC
text: TMC General Secretary Kunal Ghosh on Monday asked the BJP to reveal why former Tripura CM Biplab Deb was removed from his post. "The removal of Biplab Kumar Deb has substantiated the Trinamool Congress' allegation that the BJP dispensation is a non-performing government," he said. Notably, BJP's Manik Saha was recently named as CM of Tripura.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Saffron flag may become national flag someday: KS Eshwarappa
text: Former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said that the saffron flag didn't get its "respect today or yesterday", but that it has a "history of thousands of years". "The saffron flag may become the national flag...today or someday. There is no doubt in it," he added. Furthermore, he said that the saffron flag is "a symbol of sacrifice".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BSP won't contest Rampur LS bypoll nor support anyone: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati said that party won't contest Rampur parliamentary constituency bypoll, nor will it support any other party on seat. She, however, added that BSP will contest Azamgarh bypoll with "full strength". Bypolls on these seats are being held as SP's Akhilesh Yadav and Azam Khan resigned as MPs from these seats after winning in 2022 UP Assembly polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 2nd FIR filed against BJP's Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
text: Days after an FIR was filed in Mumbai against BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks on the Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate, a second case was registered against her in Thane on Monday. The complaint was made by a madrassa teacher who claimed that Sharma's comments on the Prophet and his wife hurt his religious sentiments.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah reaches ED office in Srinagar
text: National Conference chief and ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Srinagar. The ED had issued a summon to Abdullah in connection with a money laundering case at its headquarters in Delhi today. The case pertains to alleged financial irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Cricket Association (JKCA).
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sidhu Moosewala's murder symbolic of AAP's 'misgovernance': Lekhi
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday criticised the AAP-led Punjab government over Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "This is not the first murder, it is the 90th murder since they (AAP) have come to power," Lekhi claimed. She further alleged that the murder was "symbolic of misgovernance going on in the state".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Need to examine if Uniform Civil Code affects human rights: Khurshid
text: Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Monday commented on the proposed implementation of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) by some states, stating the need to examine if UCC affects human rights. "Whether it is Uniform Civil Code or anything else, it must meet the requirements of...Indian Constitution," he added. Uttarakhand government has formed a five-member panel to prepare draft on UCC.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Kashi, Mathura not on our agenda, it is for courts to decide: Nadda
text: Speaking on the ongoing mosque-temple disputes, BJP chief JP Nadda said that contentious religious matters such as reclaiming temples in Kashi and Mathura are not on BJP's agenda. "We have always talked about the cultural development of the country. But these issues will be decided by courts and the Constitution...and BJP will implement it in letter and spirit," Nadda added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh gets bail over comment on Goddess Sita
text: A Tripura court on Monday granted bail to TMC leader Kunal Ghosh over his alleged comment on Goddess Sita. "If Lord Ram is the ultimate then why did his wife Sita have such a tragic end?" Ghosh had said. Following the TMC spokesperson's comments, a chargesheet was filed against him by five police stations for allegedly hurting Hindu sentiments.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: J&K Panthers Party chief Bhim Singh passes away, PM condoles demise
text: Jammu and Kashmir National Panthers Party (JKNPP) founder and chief Professor Bhim Singh died at the age of 80 on Tuesday morning. According to reports, Singh was unwell for more than a year. Condoling his demise, PM Modi tweeted, "Prof Bhim Singh Ji will be remembered as a grassroots leader who devoted his life for...welfare of Jammu and Kashmir."
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Nobody involved will be spared: Punjab CM Mann on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Sunday said he was "shocked and deeply saddened by the gruesome murder" of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa today. He added, "Nobody involved will be spared. My thoughts and prayers are with his family...I appeal to everyone to stay calm." Moosewala's security was withdrawn recently.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Deeply shocked & saddened: Rahul Gandhi on Sidhu Moosewala's death
text: Rahul Gandhi on Sunday reacted to the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Mansa. "Deeply shocked and saddened by the murder of promising Congress leader and talented artist, Sidhu Moosewala. My heartfelt condolences to his loved ones and fans from across the world," said Rahul. Sidhu had fought recent Punjab polls.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Congress condoles Sidhu Moosewala's demise, says 'the murder came as a terrible shock'
text: The Congress party on Sunday condoled the demise of singer and party leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in an attack in Punjab's Mansa. "The murder of Shri Sidhu Moose Wala, Congress candidate from Punjab & a talented musician, has come as a terrible shock to the Congress party & the entire nation," the party tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Moosewala had 2 commandos for security, didn't take them with him today: Police
text: Deceased singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala had four police commanders for his protection, of which two were withdrawn recently, Punjab Police DGP VK Bhawra said. Moosewala didn't take the two commandos with him on Sunday when he was shot dead, Bhawra added. "Moosewala had a private bulletproof car that he didn't take with him," the DGP added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Urge everyone to stay calm, guilty will be punished: Kejriwal on Moosewala's killing
text: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said he spoke to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann about the murder of Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa, adding that the killing was "sad and shocking". He said, "The culprits will be given the harshest punishment. I request everyone to stay strong and maintain calm." Those involved in the killing won't be spared, Mann said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP releases list of 16 Rajya Sabha candidates, fields Sitharaman from K'taka
text: The BJP on Sunday announced its list of 16 candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections. The elections for 57 seats spread across 15 states is scheduled to take place on June 10. The party has fielded Union ministers Nirmala Sitharaman and Piyush Goyal from Karnataka and Maharashtra, respectively.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Abject law & order breakdown in Punjab: Badal on Moosewala's death
text: Reacting to the murder of Congress leader and Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal said that Punjab exhibits an "abject breakdown of law and order". Expressing shock, Badal added that those responsible for the crime should be arrested immediately. Moosewala was reportedly shot over 20 times by unknown assailants in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Am I less deserving?: Congress' Nagma after being denied RS seat
text: After Congress leader Nagma was denied a seat in the Rajya Sabha polls, she asked, "[Imran Pratapgarhi] is accommodated in Rajya Sabha from Maharashtra. I ask am I less deserving." The actor-turned-politician said, "Sonia ji, our Congress president had personally committed to accommodating me in RS in 2003/04 when I joined Congress party on her behest."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Cong releases list of 10 candidates for RS polls, fields P Chidambaram from TN
text: The Congress on Sunday released its list of 10 candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections. The party has fielded P Chidambaram from Tamil Nadu, Randeep Singh Surjewala from Rajasthan and Ajay Maken from Haryana. The elections for 57 seats spread across 15 states is scheduled to take place on June 10.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: AAP tinkered with security for publicity: Jakhar on Moosewala's death
text: BJP's Sunil Jakhar on Sunday termed the murder of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala "utterly shocking", stating that CM Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government should be held accountable. Jakhar, who recently quit Congress, added that AAP had tinkered with "security issues to gain cheap publicity". Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa a day after police withdrew his security.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Nobody safe in Punjab: Ex-CM Amarinder on Sidhu Moosewala's murder
text: Former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Sunday, while condoling the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, said, "Nobody is safe in Punjab." "The brutal murder of Sidhu Moosewala is shocking...Law and order has completely collapsed in Punjab," Amarinder tweeted. "The AAP government in Punjab has failed miserably," the Congress veteran further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Moosewala's family being forced to get done last rites soon: Punjab Cong chief
text: The family of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead, is being forced to get the post-mortem and last rites done soon, Punjab Congress chief, Amarinder Singh Raja Warring, said. "Why was security withdrawn when there was a threat perception and it was made public?" Warring added. Moosewala's family earlier refused to allow post-mortem on his body, reports said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP needs no certificate from Majlis: G Kishan Reddy on Owaisi's remarks
text: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy has responded to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's recent statements that the BJP and RSS are "only after Mughals". "Numerous Hindus had to leave their residence under Owaisi's leadership...We don't want the certificate of Majlis party given to us nor to our government," Reddy said. He added that Owaisi is selling and telling stories.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Rajya Sabha has become a parking lot: Congress' Manish Tewari
text: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Monday said that the Rajya Sabha has now become a "parking lot". "In my personal opinion, Rajya Sabha has stopped carrying out the functions for which it was constituted," Tewari added. It needs to be examined whether or not the country needs the Rajya Sabha now, the Congress leader stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong will go with collective leadership in Gujarat polls: Mevani
text: Congress backed independent MLA Jignesh Mevani has said that the party will go with a "collective leadership" in this year's Gujarat Assembly polls. However, Mevani cleared that he is not among the contenders to become CM if Congress wins the polls. "Gujarat's people are aware of the situation...during the COVID-19, the performance of the Gujarat government was pathetic," Mevani said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims: Uttar Pradesh minister
text: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims and no one's constitutional rights are being violated. "We've to listen to the voice of common Muslims," Ansari added. "Today, they want to progress that was not done by previous governments, like, SP, BSP and Congress. They only used Muslims as a vote bank," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Punjab is up in flames: BJP leader on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
text: Reacting to the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Punjab is up in flames!" "Is...Sidhu Moosewala's cold-blooded murder the change AAP promised?" he asked. "[AAP chief] Arvind Kejriwal and [MP] Raghav Chadha, who run Punjab by proxy, must be held accountable for this murder," Malviya further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: I am Hindu but not fool, we don't make religion an event: Kamal Nath
text: Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath said religion is not the basis of politics. "We don't consider religion as the basis of our politics. We don't make religion an event," Nath added. "I proudly say that I am Hindu but I am not a fool…Our religion is an event of our family, it's not an event of politics," Nath stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Somebody trying to test new govt's red lines: Manish Tewari on Moosewala's killing
text: Following Punjabi Singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, Congress leader Manish Tewari said it's obvious that somebody is trying to test the red lines of the new government. "Since the new government was formed in Punjab, there have been a series of unfortunate incidents...If peace of a border state gets disturbed then it can have various implications," Tewari added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: India has become one of the fastest growing economies in world: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that coming out of the negative impact of COVID-19, India has become one of the fastest-growing economies in the world. India trusted its scientists, doctors and youth during the COVID-19 pandemic and did not become a problem but was a solution-giver for the world, PM added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: After Ram Temple in Ayodhya, looks like Kashi & Mathura waking up too: UP CM
text: The temple town of Kashi appears to be waking up, as are Mathura, Vrindavan, Vindhyavasini Dham and Naimish Dham, after the construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "In this situation, we all have to move forward once again," CM Yogi added. His remarks came amid legal proceedings over the temple-mosque issues in Varanasi and Mathura.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We'll meet Shah if we don't get justice: Punjab Cong chief on Moosewala's killing
text: After Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa, state Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said the party will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah if they don't get justice. "We will go to high court and will meet the Governor," Warring added. "It needs to be investigated under a sitting judge and the NIA," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Muslims won't accept interference in Islamic laws: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind on UCC
text: The Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind (JUH) passed a resolution against Uniform Civil Code (UCC), saying that Muslims will not accept any kind of interference in Islamic laws. "The government in power is determined to implement the UCC…and is trying to neglect the real spirit of the Constitution," the resolution said. Issues like marriage, divorce and inheritance are guided by religion, it said.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Centre scared of Gupkar, their Kashmir policy has failed: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti has claimed that the Centre is scared of People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD), also known as the 'Gupkar alliance', adding that the Centre's policy has failed in J&K. "If [Gupkar comes] together, [Centre's]...plan will fail in...valley," she added. PAGD is a political grouping which was formed after the abrogation of Article 370.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Trapped in scams before 2014, India now achieving new heights: PM
text: India was trapped in scams and nepotism before 2014 but it is achieving new heights now, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "Corruption, scams...nepotism…the country is getting out of the vicious cycle in which it was trapped before 2014," PM added. "The heights that India has achieved in the last eight years, no one could have imagined earlier," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP only talks about communalism, has no other topics: Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday claimed that the BJP only discusses issues linked to communalism and religious conversion as the party has no other topics to address. Baghel further stated that the state government has always taken action when it received reports of forced religious conversion incidents. "Every person is free to follow their religion," he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: JD(S) workers, farmer leader Kodihalli's supporters clash in B'luru
text: JD(S) workers and supporters of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha leader Kodihalli Chandrashekar clashed in Bengaluru as the farmer leader arrived at the Press Club to address corruption charges raised against him over KSRTC workers' protests. The JD(S) workers had raised slogans and reportedly tried to stop Chandrashekar from entering the Press Club. Chandrashekar had joined AAP recently.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Sidhu Moosewala's security cover was withdrawn by Punjab govt a day ago
text: Sidhu Moosewala's security was withdrawn by the Punjab government a day before he was shot dead on Sunday. Moosewala was among around 400 people whose securities were withdrawn recently. The singer-turned-Congress leader was killed after over 20 rounds of bullets were fired by unidentified assailants at him in Jawaharke village.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: It will happen again: Chidambaram on Aryan Khan drugs case
text: After Aryan Khan was given clean chit in drugs case, Congress leader P Chidambaram took to Twitter to quote an editorial saying, "What was done to Aryan Khan mustn't happen again." Chidambaram said, "Unfortunately, it will happen again. Only the courts can stop the misuse of law." "And when it happens again, I'd like to see media reporting," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: AAP nominates 2 Padma Shri awardees for Rajya Sabha from Punjab
text: The Punjab unit of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday nominated environmentalist Balbir Singh Seechewal and entrepreneur, philanthropist and social activist Vikramjit Singh Sahney as its candidates for Rajya Sabha seats from the state. Notably, both the nominees are Padma Shri awardees. The biennial elections to 57 Rajya Sabha seats will be held on June 10.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP will make your children goons, rioters and rapists: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, while addressing a rally in Haryana, said those who want their children to become goons, rioters and rapists should send them to the BJP. "Those who want their children to become doctors, engineers, lawyers, come with us [AAP]," he added. "They'll teach your children to riot and send their children abroad," Kejriwal said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Know him well, charges are false: Maneka on officer transferred in dog walking row
text: BJP MP Maneka Gandhi has defended IAS officer Sanjeev Khirwar who was transferred from Delhi for allegedly closing a stadium early to walk his dog. Calling his transfer "wrong", Gandhi said, "I know Khirwar very well. The allegations against him are false." Saying that "Delhi benefitted from his work" in the Environment Department, Maneka called Khirwar's transfer "Delhi's loss".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Supporters of Oppn parties will vote for me: Dhami on Champawat bypoll
text: Ahead of the Assembly bypoll for the Champawat seat, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday said that even supporters of Opposition parties will give their votes to him. "It's not even a party poll now. Some people were from BSP, SP, Congress and AAP, everyone's now saying that they'll give their vote to me," Dhami added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP, RSS only after Mughals: Asaduddin Owaisi
text: Addressing a rally in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP and RSS. "If India belongs to anyone, it's Dravidians and Adivasis but BJP-RSS are only after Mughals," Owaisi said. "BJP, NCP, Congress...are the secular parties. They think that they shouldn't go to jail but it is okay if some Muslim party member goes," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Crude bombs hurled, houses vandalised as TMC factions clash in WB
text: Crude bombs were thrown and at least 12 houses were vandalised after a clash broke out between two factions of TMC in West Bengal's Malda on Saturday. One of the groups was led by a panchayat samiti office-bearer, while the other by TMC's area chief. TMC MLA Sabitri Mitra said that the incident had nothing to do with the party.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Debates on Gyanvapi case shouldn't be entertained in modern India: RLD chief
text: Debates such as those on Gyanvapi case should not be entertained in modern democratic India, RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary said on Sunday. "If you look at it, the law does not allow these sorts of debates (like the ongoing Gyanvapi issue) anymore…Let us not look to create more disturbances for the future using our past as an excuse," Chaudhary added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Delhi govt did nothing: Union Min on IAS couple's transfer over Delhi stadium row
text: Speaking on the Delhi stadium row in which an IAS couple was accused of using Delhi government-run Thyagraj Stadium for walking their dog, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said, "Delhi government did nothing. Centre intervened and transferred them to distant places." "It's these athletes who win medals for our country. No one should interfere with it," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AAP govt has eliminated illegal sand mining from Punjab: Minister
text: Punjab Mining Minister HS Bains has said the AAP government has eliminated illegal sand mining from the state. He said that legal mining has increased, adding, "Last year, 35,000-40,000 MT of extraction used to happen daily...now it has crossed one lakh MT." Earlier, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had said that a new comprehensive pro-people sand mining policy will be framed.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Who wants to stay with Congress? Many ready to quit: BJP's CT Ravi
text: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that many Congress leaders are ready to quit the party. "They (Opposition MLAs) are constantly in touch (with BJP). Who wants to stay with Congress? Many are ready to quit, not just in Goa but across the country," Ravi added. "We have seen Hardik Patel and Sunil Jakhar quitting Congress," Ravi stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi & his drones are both blind to people's sufferings: Cong
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's remark that he conducts surprise inspections of government work with the help of drones, Congress said, "PM Modi and his drones are alike." "Both [PM and drones] are blind to...people's sufferings," it added. Congress spokesperson Sunil Ahire tweeted, "PM Modi's drones only see what suits BJP's agenda. Chinese intrusion is a matter deliberately left unseen."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: How could Aryan Khan be imprisoned without evidence?: Chidambaram
text: After the NCB gave a clean chit to actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan in the cruise drugs case, Congress leader P Chidambaram asked, "How could he be arrested and imprisoned for 25 days without evidence?" Furthermore, NCP leader Clyde Crasto tweeted, "Who will be held responsible for...trauma this young man (Aryan) suffered?"
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: I've done nothing that'd make people hang their heads in shame: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said that he has spared no effort while serving the country in the last eight years. "I've neither allowed, nor personally...done any work that'll make...even a single person of India hang their head in shame," he said. "We've made an honest attempt to build the India of Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel's dream," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP is attacking democracy, socialism & secularism: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of "destroying" socialism, secularism and democracy in the country. "BJP still needs to understand socialism. This time the fight is not only about saving the state but also saving democracy, socialism and secularism," he said. "BJP is attacking these and destroying institutions," the SP chief added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Politicians must respect each other, we're not enemies: Vice President
text: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said that in public life, politicians must respect each other. "We are not enemies but we are only political rivals," Naidu added. "This is my advice to modern politicians, you may belong to this party or that party but we all belong to this great country," Naidu stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Had Cong accepted Savarkar's words, partition wouldn't have happened: Yogi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has claimed that if the then Congress party had listened to VD Savarkar's words then India would have been saved from partition. "Veer Savarkar was never given the honour he deserved...He did not even get his ancestral property till 1960. The word 'Hindutva' was coined by Savarkar," said CM Yogi while releasing a book on Savarkar.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Judges' innerwear is saffron: PFI leader after HC's order on Kerala rally
text: PFI leader Yahiya Thangal reacted to Kerala High Court ordering police to take action against the party over hate sloganeering at Alappuzha rally, saying that judges are "shocked" by the slogans. The reason for the shock is that judges' "innerwear is saffron", he claimed. A purported video of the rally showed a minor boy raising slogans against Hindus and Christians.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Anurag Thakur not worthy of even being councillor: AAP leader
text: AAP's Naresh Balyan said Union Minister Anurag Thakur is in politics because of his father, otherwise "he isn't worthy of even being a councillor". His remark came in reaction to Thakur's comment on the Delhi stadium row in which an IAS couple was accused of using the Delhi government-run stadium for walking their dog. "Delhi government did nothing," Thakur said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma booked over comment on Prophet
text: BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma has been booked over her comment on the Prophet Muhammad during a recent TV news debate. She is facing charges such as outraging religious sentiments based on a complaint by Raza Academy, a Muslim body in Maharashtra. Sharma claimed she received rape and death threats online after fact-checker Mohammed Zubair posted a clip of the debate.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: On what criteria RSS decides that only BJP leaders are Hindus: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the RSS in a series of tweets on Saturday. "Don't they (RSS) see Hindus outside BJP?...Based on what criteria has RSS decided that only BJP leaders are Hindus?" Siddaramaiah asked. "How many RSS office-bearers are from Dalits and backward classes?" he added. The 73-year-old politician also accused RSS of being an "Aryan" organisation.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Remember demonetisation: Derek O'Brien on RBI report on fake notes
text: After the RBI released its annual report claiming that ₹500 denomination's counterfeit notes saw an increase of 101.9% during 2021-22, TMC MP Derek O'Brien commented on the Centre's 2016 demonetisation move. "Namaskar PM Modi... Demonetisation? Remember? And how CM Mamata Banerjee swiftly took you on? How you promised the nation that it would wipe out all counterfeit currency," O'Brien tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Kerala govt has lenient view against terrorist activities: V Muraleedharan
text: Union Minister V Muraleedharan on Saturday said that the Kerala government has a "lenient view" against terrorist activities and groups. His remark came after a video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans during a PFI rally in Kerala went viral. "Such things happen in Kerala repeatedly because of covert support of the government in power," Muraleedharan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Children of poor will also become engineers, doctors: Kejriwal in H'yana
text: Ahead of civic polls, AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said if given a chance, his party will improve the condition of all schools in Haryana. "Children of poor will also become engineers and doctors," Kejriwal added while addressing a rally in Haryana. "We didn't allow private schools of Delhi to increase their fee in past seven years," Kejriwal stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Set target to win 75 seats in UP in LS polls: CM to BJP workers
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday directed BJP workers in state to begin preparations for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls and set a target to win 75 seats. In 2019, BJP had won 62 Lok Sabha seats, while its ally Apna Dal(S) bagged two seats. BJP won a second term in UP, bagging 255 seats in state's recent Assembly polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Free me from 'dishonourable' post, give it to your Principal Secy: Raj Min to CM
text: Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna in a tweet requested CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" ministerial post and give the charge of all the departments under him to CM's Principal Secretary Kuldeep Ranka. "Anyway, he is the minister of all the departments," he added. Chandna holds Sports and Youth Affairs, Skill Development, Employment and other portfolios.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 4 suspects arrested in Tamil Nadu BJP functionary's murder case
text: The Greater Chennai Police has arrested four people in connection with the murder of 33-year-old Tamil Nadu BJP SC Wing's District Secretary (Chennai Central) Balachander in Chintadripet. The deceased had seven criminal cases, including two related to attempt to murder, against him. He was provided with an armed guard by police after he complained of threat to his life.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Getting rape, death threats: BJP spokesperson after appearing on debate on Gyanvapi
text: BJP National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma has alleged that she is being "bombarded with rape, death and beheading threats" against herself and her family after her appearance on a TV debate on the Gyanvapi issue. "I've communicated the same to Delhi Police," she said. She blamed fact-checker Mohammed Zubair for the alleged threats after he tweeted a video of the debate.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: It's like ragging in colleges: Kamal Haasan on north-south cinema debate
text: Speaking on the controversy around north-south cinema, Kamal Haasan said, "It is topical, temporary, and it will pass." "It's like ragging in colleges. They then become very great friends and miss each other, they later come and hug each other with tears..it's a lack of understanding about what a diverse country India is," Haasan added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP will revive 36,000 temples destroyed by Mughals: KS Eshwarappa
text: BJP leader KS Eshwarappa said that his party will "revive" all the temples which were destroyed by Mughals. "Why was a temple shifted in Srirangapatna and a mosque built in its place? A total of 36,000 temples were destroyed by the Mughals. We will revive all of them," he said. Eshwarappa was recently sacked from Karnataka cabinet over corruption allegations.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Shouldn't be taken seriously: Gehlot on Chandna's 'free me from post' tweet
text: After Rajasthan Sports Minister Ashok Chandna requested state CM Ashok Gehlot to free him from his "dishonourable" post, the CM said, "[Chandna] might've come under some stress and commented. It should not be taken seriously." Furthermore, Chandna tweeted a day later that he and Gehlot held a "meaningful" discussion and added that the Congress family is "united" for 2023 polls.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Send drones there: Owaisi to PM Modi on Chinese infrastructure in Arunachal
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's remark that he uses drones for surprise inspections, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said that the PM must send drones to Ladakh and see how China is building a bridge over our Pangong Tso lake. "PM Modi send a drone to Arunachal, where your best friend Xi Bhai has made his colony on Indian soil," Owaisi added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: J&K's situation deteriorating: Mufti after meeting Amreen's family
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti met the family members of TV artiste Amreen Bhat, who was killed by terrorists in Budgam and said "situation is deteriorating" in the valley. "Innocent people are being killed every day," Mufti said. Criticising the Centre, she said, "Government keeps blowing its trumpet of normalcy in Jammu and Kashmir even when such gruesome incidents suggest otherwise."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Govt actions indirectly helping extremists: Venugopal on George's arrest
text: Reacting to former MLA PC George's arrest in an alleged hate speech case, MP KC Venugopal on Thursday said that the Kerala government's action is indirectly helping the extremists. "These are all dramas," he said. "Actually, the actions...are now not to solve the issue [of] communal harmony...Their action is indirectly helping...extremists, the people who want to spread hatred," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: 7 deaths in past 15 days in Sirsa due to drug overdose: Hooda
text: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda has alleged that seven deaths have taken place in the past 15 days in Sirsa district due to drug "overdose". "In Sirsa, during the last 8 years, more than 1.25 lakh people have visited the civil hospital for de-addiction. This is only the figure that has come to the fore," Hooda said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: AAP's free electricity offer troubling Gujarat BJP chief: Kejriwal
text: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday took to Twitter and asked why his offer to provide free electricity to the people of Gujarat was "troubling" state BJP chief CR Patil. "There is huge corruption in Gujarat government," Kejriwal added. His remarks come after Patil recently cautioned people against getting influenced by freebies offered by "some political leaders".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Talks of RJD-JD(U) alliance all imaginary: Tejashwi Yadav
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav refuted all rumours of RJD attempting to forge an alliance with Janata Dal (United) and said that the speculations surrounding the alliance are "imaginary". "When I went to Delhi to meet PM Modi, it was my initiative and not of CM Nitish Kumar. Does it mean I was forging an alliance with BJP?" Tejashwi said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Nothing is normal in J&K: Omar Abdullah after Amreen's killing
text: After TV artiste Amreen Bhat was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam, former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said that "nothing is normal" in the Union Territory. "Areas in and around Srinagar used to be free of militancy. Now incidents are happening one after the other," Omar Abdullah said. "There is no justification for such incidents," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Test match is for 5 days, it's only day 3: Karti on CBI questioning
text: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram on Saturday arrived at CBI Headquarters in Delhi for the third consecutive day and said, "A test match is for five days, this is just day three." Karti is being questioned in the bribe-for-visa case. A day earlier, Karti had written to the Lok Sabha Speaker over the alleged breach of his parliamentary privilege by CBI.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: CBI seized my confidential documents during raid: Karti Chidambaram
text: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has alleged that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) seized his sensitive documents during the raid on him in connection with the Chinese visa scam case. "The CBI seized my highly confidential and sensitive personal notes and papers pertaining to Parliamentary Standing Committee for Information and Technology, of which I am a Member," Chidambaram said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM Modi is silent on dynasty politics, corruption in BJP: HD Kumaraswamy
text: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has criticised PM Narendra Modi for commenting on "dynastic politics". "Modi has been speaking about dynasty rule and corruption, but is maintaining a stoic silence on dynasty politics and corruption in his own party (BJP)," Kumaraswamy alleged. He further alleged that the main goal of PM Modi is to finish the regional political parties.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Tried to built India Bapu, Sardar Patel dreamt of: PM on 8 yrs of NDA govt
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, in past eight years, the government made honest efforts to build India as dreamt by Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Patel. "Bapu wanted an India that would empower the poor, Dalit, victim, tribals, women," he stated. Over the years, government gave top priority to the service and welfare of poor, PM Modi added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Congress a 'torn-old party', has lost vision, relevance: BJP
text: BJP national spokesperson and Rajya Sabha MP Sudhanshu Trivedi on Thursday called Congress a "torn-old party" that has lost its "vision". "The Congress is progressively moving towards a stage where its relevance and necessity is completely lost," Trivedi said. His comments came after Congress released a booklet highlighting failures of BJP-led central government ahead of its eighth anniversary.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Corruption, irregularities won't be tolerated: BJP tells Himachal unit
text: The BJP has conveyed to the Himachal Pradesh leadership that allegations of corruption and irregularities against ministers and legislators won't be tolerated. It has also said that a clean record will be deciding factor for ticket distribution for the state assembly elections to be held later this year. Earlier, allegations of irregularities were made against chief secretary Ram Subhag Singh.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: No political ties between Cong, JD(S) for RS, 2023 polls: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has ruled out any alliance between the Congress and JD(S) for the upcoming Rajya Sabha polls and the next year's State Assembly elections. "We (Congress) will not have any political relationship with JD(S)," Siddaramaiah said. The elections for Karnataka's four Rajya Sabha seats will be held on June 10.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: MP to hold three-tier panchayat polls from June 25 to July 8
text: The State Election Commission (SEC) has announced that the three-tier panchayat polls in Madhya Pradesh will be held in three phases. The polling for the first phase will be held on June 25, while the polling for the second and third phases will be conducted on July 1 and July 8, respectively. The nomination process will start from May 30.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Sanjay Raut declares assets worth ₹21.14 crore ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut declared assets worth ₹21.14 crore while filing his nomination for the Rajya Sabha polls. Raut has ₹1,55,872 in cash and ₹1,93,55,809 as bank deposits, his election affidavit stated. He further owns one vehicle purchased in 2004, two revolvers and three parcels of agricultural land in Alibaug. Also, Raut's wife owns a 0.73-acre plot in Palghar.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Ex-Tripura MLA Ashish Das quits TMC, says 'can't survive in TMC'
text: Former Tripura MLA Ashish Das on Friday quit the Trinamool Congress (TMC), stating that "it's no longer possible for him to survive in the party". He said that the TMC leadership "doesn't give due respect" to its leaders, adding, "They (party leadership) don't even consider us human beings." Das had quit the BJP to join the TMC in October 2021.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 'Woh badmash hai': Manoj Tiwari on Owaisi's remark on Gyanvapi case
text: Reacting to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's remark that Muslims won't give up the Gyanvapi Mosque, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said, "Woh (Owaisi) badmash hai (He is a troublemaker)." "Only want to say this that where the proof is in front of us, no one has to fight. Let's have faith in the judiciary, we will accept court's verdict," Tiwari added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Party will win at least 25 seats in Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: BJP
text: BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that BJP will win at least 25 parliamentary seats in West Bengal in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, asserting that the party's support base among the masses is still intact. Criticising those who left BJP in Bengal and joined other parties, Chatterjee said, "Those who are leaving the party are opportunists."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Why is Guj becoming gateway of drugs?: Cong on 52kg drug seizure
text: After 52 kilograms of cocaine was seized from Gujarat's Mundra Port, Congress' spokesperson Pawan Khera asked, "Why is Gujarat becoming the gateway of drugs in India?" "We're not trying to corner the government…we're trying to protect [India's future generations]," he added. Meanwhile, BJP's spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said, "Drugs are caught in Gujarat because the government is acting strictly."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Communal parties like BJP bigger threat than dynastic politics: HD Kumaraswamy
text: Ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised PM Narendra Modi's 'Pariwarwaadi politics' remark and said that communal politics is a bigger threat to India as compared to dynastic politics. "The danger to nation is not from dynastic parties, it is posed by communal parties like BJP. Parties raising emotive issues to grab political ground are a real threat to democracy," Kumaraswamy said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Why are you in politics, go home & cook: BJP leader to Supriya Sule; her husband reacts
text: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrakant Patil on Wednesday criticised NCP's Supriya Sule, saying, "Why are you even in politics, just go home and cook." Reacting to it, her husband Sadanand Sule said BJP is misogynistic, and added, "I'm proud of my wife who is a homemaker, mother and a successful politician, one amongst many other hardworking and talented women in India."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Congress and NCP are our real enemies, not BJP: Sena's Vikas Gogawale
text: Shiv Sena (youth wing) leader Vikas Gogawale said that the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and Congress are the real enemies of the Sena and not the BJP. NCP and Congress take credit for the works done by Shiv Sena workers, he alleged. "Four former Congress corporators and a Shiv Sena corporator joined NCP last month," Gogawale further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Akhilesh asks Maurya 'You take father's money to build roads?', UP CM says 'Not right'
text: After Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya said it seems development in Uttar Pradesh has been done by selling Akhilesh Yadav's land in Saifai, the Samajwadi Party chief asked Maurya if he takes money from his father to build roads. Meanwhile, state Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said it wasn't right for Yadav to use indecent words for Maurya.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Harsh Vardhan walks out of Delhi L-G's oath ceremony, says 'They didn't keep seats for MPs'
text: Former Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan was seen walking out of the oath-taking ceremony of Delhi's new Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Thursday. "They have not kept seats for members of Parliament even," he said on being questioned why he was leaving the event. "I will write to Vinai Kumar Saxena ji," he is heard saying in video.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Samajwadi Party names RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary for Rajya Sabha polls
text: Akhilesh Yadav's Samajwadi Party (SP) on Thursday named Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief Jayant Chaudhary for Rajya Sabha polls as its third candidate. "Jayant Chaudhary will be the joint candidate of Rajya Sabha from SP and RLD," SP tweeted. This comes after Kapil Sibal, who quit Congress, filed the nomination for Rajya Sabha on Wednesday with SP's support.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: After 2014, India is witnessing political willpower & reforms: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Hyderabad on Thursday said, "If we compare last eight years with the previous three decades, we'll see that reforms couldn't take place...due to a lack of political willpower and instability." "After 2014, India is witnessing political willpower and reforms," he said. PM Modi participated in the 20th-anniversary celebrations of the Indian School of Business.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 8 years of BJP govt marked by 'misery', 'misgovernance': Congress
text: Congress on Thursday criticised the BJP government ahead of its eighth anniversary alleging that this period has been marked by 'misery' and 'misgovernance'. "While high prices are upsetting the budgets of common people...on the other [hand], communal fires are flaring," said Randeep Surjewala at a press conference. Congress also released a booklet highlighting 'failures' of the BJP government.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Conspiracy to defame state govt: Raut on ED raids linked to Maha minister
text: Following raids conducted by ED at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister and Shiv Sena leader Anil Parab, party leader Sanjay Raut said that BJP is using the central government agencies against the Opposition. "We are in support of Anil Parab…This is just a conspiracy to defame the Maharashtra government," Raut added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: NCP office-bearer allegedly attacked by BJP member in Pune
text: NCP office-bearer Appa Jadhav was attacked at his office allegedly by former BJP member Santosh Kamble and others at Narayan Peth in Pune on Wednesday. Kamble and his associates have been booked on charges of rioting. Kamble is a former office-bearer of the BJP but he doesn't hold any post in the party at present.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: It’s not possible to win polls through CBI: Jharkhand Congress chief
text: Following CBI raids at Ranchi residences of ex-Jharkhand minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey, state Congress chief Rajesh Thakur said agenda behind such raids by CBI is clear. "If someone wants to win elections through CBI then it's not possible," Thakur added. "It's the people who will decide. Yesterday the polls were notified and raids were conducted today," Thakur stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Can't stop change at national level: KCR after PM's 'pariwarwaad' remark
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said on Thursday that there will soon be a change in politics at the national level which no one can stop. "Tribals, farmers and the poor aren't happy in the country. Industries are getting closed," he added. Notably, his remarks come hours after PM Narendra Modi criticised 'pariwarwaad' (dynastic politics) at an event in Hyderabad.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Congress workers protest against vandalism of Nehru statue in MP
text: Congress workers staged a protest after some miscreants allegedly damaged the statue of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. "The incident took place on Tuesday, some BJP workers vandalised the statue of Jawaharlal Nehru. We demand the immediate arrest of the accused (by) the administration," a Congress worker said. The police have taken six people into custody.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: ED files chargesheet against K'taka Congress chief DK Shivakumar
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a chargesheet against Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar and others in a money laundering case on Thursday. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings. The ED had earlier arrested Shivakumar in September 2019.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Rahul didn't need political clearance for his London visit: Congress
text: Speaking on reports that Rahul Gandhi had no political clearance for London visit, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "If you are a minister or holding a public office or a government official, then you need political clearance." "Rahul as a parliamentarian only needed FCRA clearance. We still are a democratic country and don't live in stone age," Surjewala added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Most bogus case against me: Karti Chidambaram on 'visa for Chinese' case
text: Congress MP Karti P Chidambaram, accused of facilitating visas for Chinese nationals by flouting rules, said that every case that has been filed against him is a "bogus case". "One is bogus... another is more bogus. This one [the 'visa for Chinese' case] is most bogus," he added. The Congress leader is also accused in INX media case.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: US laws too loose, India too needs review: Chidambaram on Texas shooting
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday condemned the shooting at a school in US' Texas that claimed the lives of 21 people, including 19 students. He said that the American laws are too "loose" on gun control. "India too needs to review and tighten laws relating to acquisition and possession of firearms," Chidambaram tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Central probe agencies shouldn't misuse powers: Ajit Pawar
