text: Central investigation agencies have the right to search and raid but they should not "misuse powers", Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. His comment came in reaction to the ED raids at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister Anil Parab. "All I want to say is that action should be held in a transparent manner," Pawar added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will abolish minority reservations if BJP comes to power in T'gana: Sanjay Kumar
text: Bharatiya Janata Party's Telangana President and MP Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Wednesday said if his party comes to power in the state, the reservations for minorities will be abolished. The benefit would be provided to the Scheduled Castes (SCs), Scheduled Tribes (STs) and the poor among upper castes, he added. He also vowed to work against religious conversions in Telangana.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Cong nurtured Yasin Malik: MP Minister after Malik's sentencing
text: After Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik was sentenced in a terror funding case, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra alleged that Malik was "nurtured" by the Congress. "Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Digvijaya Singh's tweet on Yasin Malik did not come...Yasin Malik has been convicted by the court, he himself has accepted the murder on TV," Mishra said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Will get big opportunity: Yediyurappa after son denied MLC ticket
text: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has said he is confident that BJP will give his son BY Vijayendra a big opportunity in the future. The statement comes a day after Vijayendra was not named in candidate list for MLC polls. "The party will not forsake those who are capable and loyal," said Yediyurappa. The party will create opportunities, he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Centre, Bengal govt fooling farmers on MSP: Yogendra Yadav
text: Jai Kisan Andolan leader Yogendra Yadav criticised the Centre for making law on minimum support price (MSP) by saying that the Centre is "fooling farmers". Yadav also criticised West Bengal government for "not implementing MSP regime for crops". "This time, the protests will not just be in Delhi but in every state capital, district headquarters and block office," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Assam CM spews hate to make RSS happy: AIUDF MLA on madrasa remark
text: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA Rafiqul Islam criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over his madrasa remark and said that the latter "spews hate to make RSS happy". "He must know students from madrasas are becoming doctors and engineers," Rafiqul Islam said. Earlier, the Assam CM said madrasas should cease to exist.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP ministers to visit over 140 constituencies the party lost in 2019
text: In order to step up preparations for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday asked its ministers to visit over 140 constituencies across the country, where the party lost in 2019. The ministers will visit the constituencies from May 25 to July 31 and interact with party workers and beneficiaries of government welfare schemes.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP using CBI to scare opposition: Congress leader after CBI raids
text: After the CBI conducted raids at Ranchi residences of former state minister and Congress leader Bandhu Tirkey, he criticised the BJP and accused the party of using CBI. "Whenever there are polls in state, this happens...If we oppose wrongful BJP policies, they scare non-BJP members using CBI," Tirkey said. Tirkey was raided in connection with 34th National Games scam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: PM Modi holds roadshow as he arrives in Chennai; video surfaces
text: PM Narendra Modi was greeted by his supporters in Chennai on Thursday as he held a roadshow upon his arrival. He was received by Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi, ex-CM Edappadi K Palaniswami, as well as other senior DMK ministers. PM Modi, who was in Hyderabad earlier today, will lay foundation stones for multiple infrastructure projects in Tamil Nadu.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: AIADMK 'weak opposition', people expect me to lead: Sasikala
text: VK Sasikala, aide of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa, on Wednesday described the AIADMK under present leadership as a "weak opposition". "It's been a year since they came to power and they have been fighting with the union government. They need to implement and execute projects," she stated. Sasikala added that people are expecting her to lead the party.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Karti Chidambaram granted protection from arrest in visa scam case
text: A Delhi court has granted interim protection from arrest till May 30 to Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in the alleged money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with the bribe-for-visa case. Chidambaram is accused of receiving ₹50 lakh as bribe for re-issuance of project visas for 263 Chinese nationals. He has denied all allegations levelled against him.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Kapil Sibal resigns from Cong, files Rajya Sabha nomination with Samajwadi Party's support
text: Senior Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Wednesday filed the nomination for Rajya Sabha in the presence of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav with the party's support at its headquarters in Uttar Pradesh. "I had tendered my resignation from the Congress party on May 16," Sibal said after filing nomination for the Rajya Sabha elections.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Indian civil officer counters Rahul Gandhi at Cambridge University; video goes viral
text: Indian civil service officer Siddhartha Verma countered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at the University of Cambridge, a video of which has now gone viral. Verma tweeted, "I questioned Mr Rahul Gandhi on his statement that 'India is not a nation but a Union of States'. He asserted that India is not a nation but the result of negotiation between states."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Not easy to leave a relationship of 30-31 years: Kapil Sibal on quitting Congress
text: After revealing he has resigned from Congress party on May 16, former Union Minister Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said, "It's not easy to leave a relationship of 30-31 years." He added, "I'll not say anything about Congress. I've resigned, so it's not appropriate for me to say anything." Sibal filed nomination for the Rajya Sabha elections as an Independent candidate.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: How's 'Prasad' Mr Sibal: BJP's Jitin Prasada as Sibal quits Cong
text: After Kapil Sibal quit Congress and filed Rajya Sabha nomination with Samajwadi Party's support, his ex-party colleague Jitin Prasada asked, "How's the 'Prasad' Mr Sibal!" Prasada, who joined BJP after quitting Congress last year, was referring to Sibal's old tweet. "Jitin Prasada. Joins BJP. The question is will he get 'Prasada' from BJP...?" Sibal had tweeted.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Meeting someone abroad is act of courtesy: Tharoor on Rahul-Corbyn meet
text: Following Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and British MP Jeremy Corbyn's meet, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said meeting someone abroad is an act of courtesy. "It does not imply endorsement of all his ideas and views," Tharoor tweeted. "When visiting a democracy, meeting leaders from Opposition parties is a normal process, especially when the visitor is from a democracy too," Tharoor added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Take action against 'corrupt' ministers: K'taka AAP to state govt
text: The Aam Aadmi Party in Karnataka challenged the ruling BJP government to take action against 'corrupt' ministers. This comes a day after Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was dismissed on the charges of corruption. "We (AAP)...have filed several complaints over 40% commission charges sought by the BJP ministers," AAP state convener Prithvi Reddy said, demanding ouster of "tainted ministers".
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Crocodile tears: BJP after Kejriwal says Mann's action brought tears
text: Reacting to AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal's "brought tears to my eyes" statement after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann sacked a minister over corruption charges, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said, "These are crocodile tears and the country is ashamed of it." "When your own minister involves in corruption and gets caught for his sin, what is so proud of this?" Bhatia added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Centre trying to impose Gujarat-model everywhere: Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised the central government by saying that the Centre is trying to indulge in "communal politics" and impose Gujarat-model everywhere as it has nothing to offer to youths. "If Centre has strategies like Hitler against the Muslims then it should have the courage to reveal what they want to do with them at once," Mufti added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Asaduddin Owaisi is destroying the country like Jinnah: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi is doing the same work of destroying the country that Muhammad Ali Jinnah did before Independence. Accusing Owaisi of trying to mislead the Muslim community, he said, "If Owaisi does not stop the act of breaking the country, then he will have to spend time in the jail only."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: People come & go from Congress: Venugopal on Kapil Sibal's exit
text: Reacting to ex-Union Minister Kapil Sibal's exit from Congress, party leader KC Venugopal said "people come and go" from Congress. "[Sibal] had already written a letter to...party president...[it said] that he firmly believed in...Congress' values," he stated. Sibal, who was affiliated with Congress for over 30 years, filed nomination for Rajya Sabha polls with Samajwadi Party's support today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Not our culture: Raut on Stalin meeting Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin for meeting Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict AG Perarivalan, upon his release, saying, "If CM felicitates his assassins, I think it's not our culture." "Everyone knows Tamil Nadu's politics. Rajiv Gandhi was nation's leader. He sacrificed himself. He was assassinated in Tamil Nadu," Raut added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP leaders detained in Andhra over protest to rename Jinnah Tower
text: Several BJP members, including National Secretary Sunil Deodhar, were detained by police on Tuesday in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur. They reportedly marched towards the Jinnah Tower, demanding that the tower be renamed after India's former President Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. Condemning the arrests, BJP Rajya Sabha member GVL Narasimha Rao tweeted, "Wondering if we're in AP [Andhra Pradesh] or in Pakistan?"
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Karti Chidambaram summoned by CBI in bribe-for-visa case
text: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has been summoned by the CBI for questioning in connection with the bribe-for-visa case. Punjab-based Talwandi Sabo Power Ltd allegedly paid Chidambaram and his close aide S Bhaskararaman ₹50 lakh for re-issuance of project visas for 263 Chinese workers in 2011. The Enforcement Directorate also filed case against Chidambaram on Wednesday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Crime in Bihar rising rapidly, need to sideline corrupt officers: Speaker
text: Bihar Legislative Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Tuesday said that the crime graph in Bihar is increasing rapidly. "We have to bring honest officers into the field and sideline the corrupt ones," Sinha added. "We have to curb the mentality of those involved in corruption. Only transferring officials will not help," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Many uniting for 2024: Sibal on filing RS nomination with SP’s support
text: After resigning from Congress and filing Rajya Sabha nomination with SP's support, Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said many people are coming together for 2024 when the Lok Sabha polls are scheduled to be held. "We, many people, are coming together for 2024. We will expose the shortcomings of the central government ahead of 2024," Sibal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Future plans are to unite Opposition to oppose BJP: Kapil Sibal
text: Soon after resigning from Congress, Kapil Sibal said that his future plans are to unite the Opposition to oppose the BJP. Sibal added that the BJP is following "anti-people policies" and is "dividing" the inclusive culture of India. "We (the Opposition) want to create an alliance so that we can oppose the (PM) Modi-led government," Sibal said after his resignation.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Lynching-accused are punished in Pak, garlanded in India: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday compared the judiciaries of India and Pakistan in terms of treatment of lynching cases. "A man was lynched in Pakistan, they sentenced six people to death...Several [people] have been lynched [in India] after 2015...The accused [have been] garlanded, not punished," she said. "That's the difference between their judiciary and [ours]," Mufti added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Reduce VAT on fuel prices: Tamil Nadu BJP chief urges DMK govt
text: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai on Tuesday urged DMK-led state government to reduce VAT on fuel prices. He claimed that the state's VAT is higher than the excise duty imposed by Centre. "[DMK]...assured to reduce ₹5 per litre on petrol and ₹4 per litre for diesel," Annamalai stated, adding that the government failed to fulfil its 2021 poll promise.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Maharashtra BJP leaders protest seeking OBC reservation in polls
text: Nearly 40 BJP workers, including senior party leaders, were detained by the Mumbai Police after they staged a protest against the MVA government, seeking reservation for the OBCs in elections. An official said that the detained BJP workers were taken to Mumbai's Azad Maidan and later released. "This government seeks revenge and behaves like [the] British," BJP's Sudhir Mungantiwar said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: All the best: Ashwani Kumar as Kapil Sibal quits Congress
text: Former Union Minister and former Congress leader Ashwani Kumar wished Kapil Sibal 'all the best' after he quit the Congress party. "Every person has the right to decide his strategy and political strategy according to his conscience," Ashwani Kumar said. "After the 'Chintan Shivir', there are many people who have said goodbye to the party," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: 'Evidence too sketchy': HC grants PDP leader bail in terror case
text: PDP leader Waheed Para was granted bail in a terror conspiracy case by the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday. "The evidence as is gathered by the prosecution is too sketchy to be believed prima facie true," said the court. The bench cited the Supreme Court's recent ruling on sedition while granting the relief.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Caste-based census will ensure social equality in India: Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar on Wednesday demanded that a caste-based census be conducted nationally, stating that it'll ensure social equality in India. Pawar added that Centre will be able to adequately provide concessions to the OBC community with the help of such a census. Notably, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has convened all-party meet to discuss the issue.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: TMC has culture of bringing Rohingyas: BJP leader Saumitra Khan
text: BJP leader Saumitra Khan on Wednesday accused the Trinamool Congress (TMC) of propagating "a culture of bringing Rohingyas" to sustain itself in the government in West Bengal. Khan had earlier sought a ban on TMC, alleging that the party is responsible for the influx of Rohingya refugees in India. He had also termed the TMC a "terror supply party".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Denied ticket, K'taka Cong Gen Secy says party ignoring 50% of population
text: Karnataka Congress General Secretary Kavitha Reddy criticised her party after being denied ticket in the upcoming Legislative Council elections and said that social justice is irrelevant and incomplete without gender justice. "Why is Congress ignoring 50% of...population? Is there no representation for women in our Assembly, Council, or Parliament at all? Is it no entry for women?" she said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Vijay Singla’s arrest is face-saving exercise for AAP: Punjab Cong chief
text: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja termed Punjab Minister Vijay Singla’s arrest, after he was sacked by CM Bhagwant Mann, as a "face-saving" exercise for AAP. "You can’t get away by just making a symbolic case while letting others go scot-free as Singla was not the only suspect in the pack, there are others as well," Raja added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: ED books Karti Chidambaram for money laundering in Chinese visa case
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has booked Congress MP Karti Chidambaram and others in connection with a money laundering case related to issuance of visas to 263 Chinese nationals in 2011. The agency said that it filed the case taking cognisance of an FIR by CBI in the matter. Chidambaram and his associate have been accused of taking ₹50 lakh bribe.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Why shouldn't BJP be an option: Hardik Patel after quitting Congress
text: When asked if the Bharatiya Janata Party is an option for him after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said, "Why shouldn't it be?" When asked if he has an offer from a party, he said, "Offers and bargains are for weak people...Strong people create a space for themselves." Patel also added there is no clarity about where he will go.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Won't spare even our own leaders: Kejriwal as Mann sacks AAP minister
text: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state minister Vijay Singla over corruption allegations, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said AAP "won't spare" even its own leaders if found involved in corruption. "No one knew about this corruption, neither the media nor Opposition. Had CM Mann wanted, he would've asked for a slice of it with a 'setting'," the AAP chief added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP criticises Rahul for meeting 'anti-India' British MP; Cong replies
text: The BJP on Tuesday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for meeting British MP Jeremy Corbyn, who is known for his "anti-India" and "anti-Hindu" remarks and for advocating the separation of Kashmir from India. Meanwhile, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala, while sharing a picture of PM Narendra Modi with Corbyn, asked, "Does it mean PM has endorsed Jeremy Corbyn's views on India?"
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Ajay Kothiyal, who was AAP's Uttarakhand CM face, joins BJP
text: The Aam Aadmi Party's CM candidate for recently-held Uttarakhand Assembly elections, retired Colonel Ajay Kothiyal, on Tuesday joined the BJP in Dehradun. He joined the party in the presence of Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami. Kothiyal had resigned from AAP on May 18. He had contested the Assembly polls from the Gangotri Assembly constituency.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: My father's death was the single biggest learning experience of my life: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said the death of his father and the former PM of India Rajiv Gandhi was "the single biggest learning experience" of his life. His father's death caused him "tremendous pain", Rahul said, adding, "But...I can't get away from the fact that [it] also made me learn things that I would never ever have learnt otherwise."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Temple's character can't change with demolition: BJP leader
text: Amid the ongoing Gyanvapi mosque case, BJP leader and lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay said that a temple's religious character does not change after the demolition of roof, walls, pillars, foundation and even offering namaz. "After the 'pran pratishtha' of idol, a temple always remains a temple until the idol is shifted to another temple with the rituals of 'visharjan'," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong forms task force for LS polls, adds strategist Sunil Kanugolu
text: Congress has constituted 'Task Force 2024' ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and roped in political strategist Sunil Kanugolu as a member. Senior party leaders including P Chidambaram, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Jairam Ramesh and Randeep Singh Surjewala are also members of this task force. Notably, this comes weeks after political strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Gujarat polls to be one-sided, don't see Congress anywhere: Hardik
text: Former Congress leader Hardik Patel, who quit the party days ago, said that the upcoming elections in Gujarat will be "one-sided" in BJP's favour. He added, "I don't see Congress anywhere." When asked if he was considering BJP as an option, Patel said, "Why shouldn't it be?" Patel further said that AAP has a better electoral strategy than Congress.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Wherever AAP goes, it takes corruption with it: BJP spokesperson
text: After the removal of Punjab Health Minister and AAP leader Vijay Singla, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said it is only AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal who can give a "100% corruption rate". "The people of Punjab and the country are saying that wherever this party goes, it takes corruption with itself," Bhatia added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Pak govt says will hold polls in August 2023, not before: Report
text: The Pakistani government led by PM Shehbaz Sharif has rejected his predecessor Imran Khan's demand to hold elections early, according to a report quoting sources. The ruling PML-N reportedly said the elections would be held in August 2023, after the completion of the ongoing term. Notably, Khan is planning a protest march to Islamabad seeking dissolution of the National Assembly.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Remove Savarkar's portrait from Hyd museum: T'gana Cong urges state govt
text: Telangana Congress on Wednesday urged the state government to remove Veer Savarkar's portrait from Hyderabad's Salar Jung museum. It urged the government to replace it with portraits of freedom fighters like Mahatma Gandhi, Bhagat Singh or Nizams of Hyderabad. "The Nizam family...donated several antique pieces. However...government didn't acknowledge it," said Congress leader Osman Mohammed Khan.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP denies ticket to BS Yediyurappa's son for upcoming MLC polls
text: The BJP announced its candidates for the upcoming Karnataka MLC elections in which the party denied ticket to BJP leader BS Yediyurappa's son, Vijayendra Yeddyurappa, who is the present State Vice President of the party. The Karnataka BJP core committee had earlier recommended over a dozen names as probable candidates, including Vijayendra, for the MLC polls, reports said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Telangana Cong MLA criticises TRS on latter's RS candidate choice
text: Telangana Congress Working President Jagga Reddy has criticised the TRS government for reportedly nominating industrialist Bandi Parthasaradhi Reddy to the Rajya Sabha. "How can a person who committed a major scam is given a Rajya Sabha seat," asked Jagga. The Congress MLA further accused Parthasaradhi of indulging in the alleged Remdesivir medicine scam during the pandemic in the state.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Nothing Hindu about wanting to murder, beat up people: Rahul
text: While being questioned about how Congress would fight 'Hindu nationalism', party leader Rahul Gandhi said that there is "nothing" Hindu and nationalist about the term, reported PTI. He added that he's studied Hinduism in "enough detail" and there's "absolutely nothing Hindu about wanting to murder people and beat people up". Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University's Corpus Christi College.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Chennai transforming into a 'city of killings': AIADMK leader
text: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Tuesday alleged that Tamil Nadu's capital Chennai is transforming into a 'city of killings'. Chennai alone witnessed 18 murders in 20 days, Palaniswami said, adding that a question mark hangs over people's security. He further blamed CM MK Stalin, who holds the police portfolio, for 'not improving' law and order situation in the state.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Sonia Gandhi forms new groups, task force for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
text: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has formed a 'Political Affairs Group' that will be presided by her, a 'Task Force-2024' and a 'Central Planning Group' for the coordination of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Each member of the task force shall be assigned specific tasks related to organisation, communications and media, outreach, finance and election management," said the party.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: People dying in floods but Assam CM busy with hate speech: Owaisi
text: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's 'madrasa' remark, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "18 people have died in Assam and seven lakh have been affected due to floods, but he's (Himanta) busy with hate speech." "They (BJP)...have hate for Islam and Muslims," he added. Earlier, Himanta had said, "Admitting children in madrasas is a violation of their human rights."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Unlike shakhas, madrasas teach empathy: Owaisi on Assam CM's remarks
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over his madrasa comments saying, "unlike Shakhas, they [madrasas] teach self-respect and empathy." Owaisi further tweeted, "Obsessing over Muslim ancestry shows your inferiority complex. Muslims have enriched India and will continue to do so." Earlier, the Assam CM said madrasas should cease to exist.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: 5 time former Guj Cong MLA's son joins BJP along with supporters
text: Late Gujarat Congress leader Anil Joshiyara's son, Keval, joined the BJP along with around 1,300 supporters in Bhiloda, Arvalli on Tuesday. Anil, who passed away in March 2022 due to COVID-19, was elected five times as an MLA from the tribal region in North Gujarat. Notably, Gujarat BJP President CR Paatil was present to welcome Keval to the party.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: More BJP leaders waiting to join TMC: Arjun Singh after quitting BJP
text: Ex-West Bengal BJP's Vice-President Arjun Singh, who recently joined the TMC after quitting the BJP, on Tuesday claimed that more BJP leaders are waiting to join TMC. "Just wait and see what happens," he said. Reacting to his claims, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that TMC leaders are trying to create an atmosphere of mistrust in BJP's West Bengal unit.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: AAP has zero-tolerance against corruption: Punjab CM after sacking min
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, who sacked Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla from the state cabinet over corruption charges, said that his party has zero-tolerance policy against corruption. "I took [the matter] very seriously. Nobody knew about it, had I wanted it, I could have brushed it under the carpet. But I would have broken the trust of people," Mann said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP did nothing for Kashmiri Pandits' welfare: Mehbooba Mufti
text: Accusing BJP of exploiting the situation of Kashmiri Pandits, PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said BJP has done nothing for their welfare. She said Kashmiri Pandits were moved from tents to flats when Manmohan Singh was the PM. "When the situation was bad in 2016, we gave the Kashmiri Pandits salaries for 17 months while they were staying home," Mufti said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong always trying to damage faith of Hindus: Hardik Patel
text: Hardik Patel, who has recently quit Congress, said that the Congress party works to hurt the sentiments of people and is always trying to damage the faith of the Hindu religion. His statement came after he alleged that a senior Gujarat Congress leader had said that dogs urinate on bricks being used for building the Ram temple in Ayodhya.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM Modi creating vision of India that excludes masses: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said, "PM Narendra Modi is constructing a vision of India where he is leaving out huge chunks of our population." "I have a problem with it because it is completely unfair [and] because that is not what India is," Rahul said. "You have to include every single person with compassion," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Ex-Maha BJP MLA booked for ‘disproportionate assets’ worth ₹8 cr
text: Officials said the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has registered an FIR against former BJP MLA Narendra Mehta and his wife, Suman, for allegedly having "disproportionate assets" worth ₹8.25 crore. The ACB, in its complaint, stated that while serving as an MLA from Mira-Bhayandar Vidhan Sabha seat and corporator of MBMC, Mehta misused his official positions and amassed illegal assets.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Many AAP MLAs are in jail: Khattar on Punjab Minister's removal
text: After the removal of Punjab Health Minister and AAP leader Vijay Singla, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar criticised AAP, saying many of its leaders are in jail and many are removed under corruption charges. "The kind of party it is, nothing can be said...We have a stand-up policy, making people independent. They have a sit-down policy, giving freebies," he said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: AAP's CM face in Goa polls Amit Palekar to head state committee
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday announced that its chief ministerial candidate in the recently-held Goa Assembly polls, Amit Palekar, will head the party's new committee in the state. Additionally, AAP MLAs Capt Venzy Viegas and Cruz Silva will serve as the working presidents of the executive committee. AAP won two seats in the Goa elections.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Cancel water theft FIRs against 32 farmers: SAD chief to Punjab CM
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal has asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to order the cancellation of water theft FIRs immediately that have been registered against 32 farmers in Fazilka. The irrigation department officials, who were "failing" in their duty to provide requisite water to farmers of the state, were "victimising" them, Badal said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP rule worse than that of Hitler, Stalin, Mussolini, says Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the BJP's rule is worse than that of dictators Adolf Hitler, Joseph Stalin or Benito Mussolini. Mamata further accused the BJP-led central government of interfering in the state's affairs using central agencies. "The agencies must be granted autonomy and allowed to work impartially without any political interference," she added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Punjab AAP MLA, wife & son convicted in 2011 assault case; get bail
text: Punjab AAP MLA Balbir Singh, his wife, son and an aide were on Monday sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment in a 2011 assault case by a court in Rupnagar. However, the four accused were later granted bail. According to an FIR, the accused had allegedly attacked Singh's sister-in-law and her husband following a land dispute.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Sidhu taken to hospital for check-up 3 days after being lodged in jail
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu was taken to Rajindra Hospital in Patiala for a medical check-up on Monday, three days after he was lodged in jail. Earlier on May 21, Sidhu's lawyer had claimed that the former Punjab Congress chief was refusing prison food as he's allergic to wheat. Sidhu is undergoing one-year imprisonment in the 1988 road rage case.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: 1 person in custody over boy's hate slogans at PFI rally in Kerala
text: Kerala Police have taken one person into custody during an investigation into a viral video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans allegedly at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Alappuzha. Cases have also been registered against the PFI district president, secretary and other persons. The purported video shows the boy sitting on the shoulders of a person.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Does BJP want to submerge Delhi?: AAP as MCD delays cleaning drains
text: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Sunday asked BJP leaders "if they intend to submerge Delhi" as BJP-run MCD has "not [started] cleaning 95% of drains". "60 foot and smaller drains...come under BJP-run MCD's jurisdiction. These drains aren't yet cleaned even as monsoon is knocking at the door," Pathak said. BJP is playing with lives of lakhs of people, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bihar CM convenes all-party meet to discuss caste census
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has called for an all-party meet on May 27 to discuss caste census in the state. "We want to discuss each and every issue related to caste-based census...Leaders of different political parties will give their suggestions which will be a great help," he said. Notably, Kumar recently met Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav over same issue.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Congress' existence is on ventilator: Union Minister Naqvi
text: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that the Congress' existence is on a "ventilator", adding that the "idiocy" of its leaders is on an "accelerator". Congress leaders defame India in a foreign country, Naqvi added. His comments come after Congress' Rahul Gandhi, at a recent event in London, accused the BJP-led Centre of destroying India's institutions and polarising the country.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Tax terrorism persists in case of petrol, diesel: Kerala Youth Cong Prez
text: Youth Congress Kerala-unit President and Congress MLA Shafi Parambil has accused the state government of "tax terrorism" in the case of fuel prices. "Tax terrorism still persists in the case of petrol and diesel. Even at this moment, the state government levies a tax of ₹24.32 per litre on petrol...charges ₹18.07 per litre of diesel," Parambil said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Joined BJP because I was impressed by PM Modi's ideology: Khali
text: Wrestler Dalip Singh Rana, popularly known as 'The Great Khali', said on Monday that he joined BJP because he was impressed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ideology. Khali, who made the remarks after meeting Union Minister Jitendra Singh, further stated that he's proud to have joined the party. Khali joined BJP at the party's headquarters in Delhi on February 10.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Over 100 activists of Imran Khan's party arrested in Pakistan
text: Over 100 activists of former PM Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf have been reportedly arrested ahead of a planned march to capital Islamabad. The PTI supporters are seeking early elections in the country. The police is said to have acted on the instructions of the ruling PML-N coalition. Most of the arrests were made in Lahore, said a PTI official.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Entry to religious institutions should be at certain age: Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said entry to any religious institution should be allowed at an age when students can make their own decisions. "Madrasa should be a system of education that can give students the choice to do anything in the future," Biswa added. "Admitting children in madrasas is a violation of their human rights," Biswa stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 8 ex-MLAs join Congress in Haryana, 'party on comeback' says Hooda
text: As many as eight former MLAs joined Congress in Haryana on Monday. They include Sharda Rathore, Ram Niwas Ghorela, Naresh Selwal, Parminder Singh Dhull, Zile Ram Sharma, Rakesh Kamboj, Rajkumar Valmiki and Subhash Chaudhary. "The party is on a comeback in Haryana," Congress leader and former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on the occasion.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: AAP dissolves its Goa working committee, says will reorganise
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) dissolved its Goa working committee on Monday, months after the conclusion of the Assembly elections. The party's state incharge Atishi said that the new committee will be reorganised soon. "With expansion of the party in mind…we will constitute a new committee to bring well-meaning and like-minded people into the party's fold," she said.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Encourages separatists: Himanta Sarma on Rahul's 'Union of States' remark
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "Union of States" remark made in London last week. "He (Rahul) is indirectly encouraging separatist elements by describing India as a federation of states," CM Sarma said. "He is promoting separatist sentiments...There is no difference between his language and that of militant outfit ULFA," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Temples damaged by Portuguese should be reconstructed in state: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday said that the temples damaged by the "Portuguese" should be reconstructed in the state. "Till date, the tourists were attracted only to beaches but now it's our duty to bring them to temples," Sawant added. The allocation from the budget for reconstruction of temples has already been made, Sawant stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kirit Somaiya's wife files ₹100 crore defamation suit against Sanjay Raut
text: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's wife, Medha, has filed a defamation suit of ₹100 crore against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut in Bombay High Court. Kirit has said that they don't want the defamation money, adding that it should instead be used for social work. Notably, Raut had accused the duo of being involved in the alleged Mira-Bhayandar's public toilets scam.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP searches votes in temples, we search God in Shivling: Cong leader
text: The BJP searches for votes in the temple while the Congress searches for "God in Shivling", Congress leader Pramod Krishnam said. He was speaking on the Shivling claimed to be found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. "Our party works on the ideology of 'Sarvdharm Sambhav'. We are followers of Mahatma Gandhi. Will follow court's judgement," Krishnam added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Inspector warned me of 'encounter' after bail: SP leader Azam Khan
text: Samajwadi Party leader (SP) Azam Khan claimed that an inspector in jail had warned that he could be encountered post his bail. "When an inspector [says] 'go underground, you have several cases against you'...it's difficult to say where I'm headed," he added. Khan was granted interim bail by SC in alleged land grabbing case and forgery case in UP's Rampur.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I'm Hindu, will eat beef if I want to: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
text: Congress' Siddaramaiah said that he is a Hindu who had not consumed beef till now, but he would eat beef if he wanted to. "Beef eaters don't belong to just one community, even Hindus consume beef, Christians consume it as well...I have even said it in Karnataka Assembly. Who are you to tell me to not consume beef?" Siddaramaiah said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Unlike Shakhas they teach empathy: Owaisi on Assam CM’s ‘madrasa’ remark
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi reacted to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s 'madrasa' remark, saying that they teach self-respect and empathy “unlike Shakhas”. "Illiterate Sanghis wouldn’t understand. Why did Hindu social reformer Raja Ram Mohan Roy study in a madrasa?" Owaisi tweeted. "Obsessing over Muslim ancestry shows your inferiority complex," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Need to have structures to ensure technology doesn't shape us: Ram Madhav
text: RSS leader Ram Madhav said we are entering an era where machines that we trained are going to be more intelligent than humans. "Technology is our creation. It needs to be contained, just as we have physical highways, we need to have proper structures to ensure technology does not shape us," Madhav added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Akhilesh Yadav has been too used to air-conditioned rooms: OP Rajbhar
text: SBSP National President Om Prakash Rajbhar said his ally SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has been "too used to air-conditioned rooms". "His party leaders complain that he does not meet anyone. He should venture out more often to constituencies," Rajbhar said. "Akhilesh's leaders have told me that I should advise him so that he meets people," Rajbhar stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: British pitted Hindus against Muslims, today BJP is doing it: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said the British pitted Hindus against Muslims and today the BJP is doing it. Her statement came in reaction to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's remark that the madrasa should be a system of education that can give students the choice to do anything in the future. "PM is watching silently," Mufti added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: T'gana BJP workers to go door-to-door to brief people on welfare schemes
text: Telangana BJP chief Tarun Chugh said that the state BJP workers would inform people about the party's welfare schemes on the completion of eight years of PM Modi's government. "BJP workers will go to every house for 14 days and brief [people]," Chugh said. The program will be started by JP Nadda in Delhi from May 30, he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AAP’s Delhi model can’t be replicated everywhere: Himachal CM
text: AAP’s Delhi model may have worked but they do not have a long-term model for being successful, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said. "The model cannot be replicated everywhere as each place has a different set of characteristics," Thakur added. "It worked in Punjab but in Himachal, other parties have failed. Mayawati tried, SP tried...none of them succeeded," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Namaz not offered on roads on Eid for 1st time in UP: CM Yogi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that for the first time, namaz on Eid and Alvida Juma (last Friday of Ramadan) was not offered on roads in the state. "Ram Navami was celebrated in a grand manner in UP," CM Yogi added. "Earlier, there used to be riots in Muzaffarnagar, Meerut, Moradabad and other places," CM Yogi stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Haryana local body polls to be held on June 19
text: The Haryana State Election Commissioner Dhanpat Singh has announced that the elections for the 46 local bodies of Haryana will be held on June 19. Voters can cast their votes between 7 am to 6 pm while the counting of votes will take place on June 22. Notably, the process of nomination will continue from May 30 to June 4.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Rabri Devi slaps her supporter for heckling officers during raid at her home
text: A video showing former Bihar CM Rabri Devi slapping an RJD supporter for heckling CBI officers has gone viral online. The incident took place when CBI officers raided Rabri and Lalu Yadav's Patna residence in connection to the railway recruitment scandal. Rabri is seen telling protesters to calm down and then slapping a supporter for blocking officers' exit.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Arjun Singh, former West Bengal BJP Vice-President, rejoins TMC after 3 years
text: BJP Lok Sabha MP Arjun Singh on Sunday joined the Trinamool Congress after quitting the BJP. Singh, who was the West Bengal BJP's Vice-President, had left the TMC and joined BJP in 2019 ahead of the Lok Sabha election. He joined TMC in the presence of the party's General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee in Kolkata.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Nehru left us to be with Pakistan: Assam CM on Rahul Gandhi's remarks in London
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has said that Assam never negotiated peace with India. He added, "With Gandhiji's support, Gopinath Bordoloi had to struggle to keep Assam with Bharat Mata since Nehru left us to be with Pakistan as per Cabinet Mission Plan." This comes after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "UP, Maharashtra, Assam, Tamil Nadu created a negotiated peace."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Congress compares excise duty on petrol and diesel in May 2014 and now
text: After the Centre reduced excise duty on fuel, Congress compared the excise duty in May 2014 and now. Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala tweeted that excise duty on petrol in May 2014 was ₹9.48/litre and it is ₹19.90/litre now after Centre's duty cut. Surjewala added that excise duty on diesel was ₹3.56/litre and it is ₹15.80/litre after the tax cut.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sitharaman compares development spendings before & after 2014 after fuel price cut
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified that the burden of recent petrol and diesel price cut will be borne by the Centre and compared developmental expenditure incurred by governments before and after 2014. "Expenditure incurred by the [Narendra Modi-led] govt during 2014-22 was ₹90.9 lakh crore...Only ₹49.2 lakh crore was spent on developmental expenditure during 2004-14," she stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I stand corrected: Chidambaram on tweets criticising govt after fuel price cut
text: Congress' P Chidambaram has said the facts of Centre's fuel price reduction are contrary to what he had previously claimed, adding, "I stand corrected." "Entire burden of the reduction falls on the Centre," he admitted. He had earlier said the Finance Minister's exhortation to states is meaningless as 41 paise of a rupee in "central excise" belong to the states.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Farmers can topple governments: Telangana CM KCR in Punjab
text: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday, after paying tribute to the farmers who died during the anti-farm laws protests last year, said, "Farmers can topple governments." Urging farmers' leaders to not stop their agitation against the Centre, Rao said, "We...would always support our farmer brothers and sisters." Telangana is improving, giving farmers free electricity, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will implement Delhi model of schools in Telangana: CM KCR
text: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Saturday said that his government will implement Delhi model of schools in the state. "We will soon send a team of officers from our state to coordinate," Rao added. His statement came as he, along with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, visited a Delhi government school in the national capital on Saturday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ashamed this is happening in my country: Kapil Sibal on Neemuch killing
text: Congress leader Kapil Sibal condemned the killing of a mentally unstable man in Madhya Pradesh’s Neemuch. One man has been arrested for thrashing him to death. "Differently-abled elderly man beaten to death on suspicion of being a Muslim. I am ashamed that this is happening in my country," Sibal tweeted on Sunday.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Some planned to lay down a trap: MNS chief on cancelling Ayodhya trip
text: After cancelling his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray said, "Those who were rattled by my announcement to visit Ayodhya were planning to lay down a trap." Addressing a rally in Pune, he added that many people did not like his decision to put the plan on hold.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: There's no fight for Kashi, Mathura as it's all self-evident: Uma Bharti
text: There is no fight for Kashi and Mathura because it's all "self-evident", BJP's Uma Bharti said. She was referring to some sacred symbols which were reportedly found on the outer walls of Gyanvapi Mosque. "Kashi Vishwanath is among the 12 jyotirlingas...the shivling and the temple there are very special. There is no question of a fight there," Bharti added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Did not discuss Cabinet expansion with BJP top brass: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that he did not discuss the issue of Cabinet expansion with the BJP top brass during his recent visit to Delhi. "I met BJP state in-charge Arun Singh...and discussed the Legislative Council and Rajya Sabha elections," Bommai said. Earlier this month, Bommai had said that Cabinet expansion will take place shortly.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Will think about where I missed out in my loyalty: Azam Khan
text: SP leader Azam Khan said he will think about where he missed out in his loyalty and became a "vessel of hatred". His statement comes after he was given interim bail. On being asked why his party didn't raise concern for him, Khan added, "I was in jail for a long time, don’t know what happened politically."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Told Nadda about BJP's shortcomings in Bengal, Kerala: Arjun Singh
text: Ex-BJP West Bengal Vice-President Arjun Singh said that he had spoken to BJP National President JP Nadda about the party's shortcomings in Bengal and Kerala. "[Nadda had] said that he'll think about it...It's upon the party as a whole how it'll tackle them," he added. Singh, who's BJP's Lok Sabha MP from Barrackpore, rejoined TMC after three years on Sunday.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Pune Police chief asks political outfits to hold protests peacefully
text: In an all-party meet, the Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta requested the political outfits to hold protests peacefully and ensure the law and order situation doesn't get affected in Pune. Gupta also asked the parties to carry out protests at designated spots only. The meet was called in the wake of recent clashes in Pune between cadres of various outfits.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Don't want to leave space uncontested for BJP: Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said her party will contest the upcoming J&K panchayat elections as she "does not want to leave any space uncontested for BJP". I am not going to be in power politics for quite sometime now, Mufti said. "To thwart [BJP's] designs, if [political parties] have to come together and fight elections unitedly, why not?" she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Raj Thackeray asks PM to change Aurangabad's name to Sambhajinagar
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Sunday requested PM Narendra Modi to change the name of Aurangabad to Sambhajinagar. "I request the Prime Minister to bring Uniform Civil Code at the earliest, also bring a law on population control," Thackeray added while addressing a rally in Pune. The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Thackeray's public rally.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: India on road to contribute 15% of world GDP by 2047: Scindia
text: India has to focus on building capability as it is on the road to providing 25% of the total global workforce and contributing 15% of global GDP by 2047, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said. "India has shown that the Indian way of globalisation will show the path for globalisation that will be balanced...and pivoted on territorial integrity," Scindia added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Better than nothing: Pawar over excise duty cut on petrol, diesel
text: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said, "It is better than nothing." Notably, PM Narendra Modi-led government on Saturday cut excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Several conditions imposed by police for Raj's Pune rally on Sunday
text: The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Raj Thackeray's public rally at the Ganesh Kala Krida Manch on Sunday. Some notable conditions imposed are that the rally should be held between 10 am-2 pm, and speakers must ensure that their speech doesn't offend a particular community. Also, decibel limits of loudspeakers, as per government norms, need to be ensured.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Rahul Baba must take out his Italian specs: Amit Shah
text: Criticising Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his recent remarks on the BJP-ruled Centre, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that "Rahul baba must take out his Italian specs". "He (Rahul) must have a look at the development work done by PM Modi & CM Pema Khandu," said Shah while laying the foundation stone of various projects in Arunachal Pradesh.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: India can be world's 4th largest economy by 2047: Scindia
text: India can become the world's fourth largest economy by 2047, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Saturday. "By the year 2047, there will be full saturation of all the government schemes and a per capita income of ₹53,000 in 2010-11, will reach above ₹4 lakh per person by 2047," Scindia added. He was speaking at the 7th India Ideas Conclave.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rahul is India's most unsuccessful, frustrated politician: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is "India's most unsuccessful, frustrated and despondent politician". "No politicians make comments against the country as Rahul Gandhi does on foreign land," Chouhan said after Gandhi on Saturday said India is not in a "good place" at the 'Ideas for India' conclave in London.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Was born in India: TMC's Alo Sarkar on being ruled B'deshi national
text: Trinamool Congress' Alo Rani Sarkar said on Saturday that she was born in India in 1969. She added that her family permanently moved to the country in 1971, further stating that she has ancestral property in Bangladesh. Her remarks come after Calcutta HC ruled her Bangladeshi while dismissing her petition challenging verdict of her constituency's result in Bengal Assembly polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Religion never teaches animosity: Rahul Gandhi on Neemuch killing
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while condemning the killing of a 65-year-old mentally unstable man in MP's Neemuch, said, "Religion never teaches animosity." Taking to Facebook, Gandhi wrote, "The fire of hate turns men blind and when politics preaches hate, men turn into each other's enemies." Congress leader Kapil Sibal also said, "I'm ashamed that this is happening in my country."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Opposition-ruled states should also reduce fuel rates: BJP's Nadda
text: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, BJP chief JP Nadda said that Opposition should also reduce fuel rates in the states governed by them so that the common people can get some relief amid inflation. The excise duty cut will reduce the petrol and diesel prices by ₹9.5 per litre and ₹7 per litre, respectively.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Rahul lacks consistency, needs clarity in thought process: TMC leader
text: TMC leader Sukhendu Sekhar Ray said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi lacks consistency and should bring some clarity in his thought process. "A few days back he had said the regional parties lack ideology and only Congress can fight against the BJP. Today he is saying something completely different," Ray added. Gandhi should clarify which statement is true, he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Account hacked: Adhir Ranjan as Rajiv Gandhi quote on Sikh riots tweeted by his handle
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has filed a police complaint claiming his Twitter account was hacked, after a 1984 quote by former PM Rajiv Gandhi was tweeted from his account. The now-deleted tweet had Rajiv Gandhi's "Whenever a big tree falls, the earth shakes" remark that he made after the deadly Sikh riots that followed Indira Gandhi's death.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Diplomats fixed colleges for Pt Nehru's grandkids: Rijiju as Rahul criticises IFS
text: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the current Indian Foreign Service (IFS), Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "Diplomats (under Congress government) were busy fixing colleges for grandkids of (ex-PM) Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru." Rijiju shared tweets by the great-grandson of a former government official, which showed ex-Foreign Secretary TN Kaul seeking advice on colleges for Rajiv Gandhi.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Don't see Cong as 'big daddy': Rahul after criticism on his regional parties remark
text: After Rahul Gandhi was criticised for his remarks saying regional parties 'lacked ideologies' to take on BJP, the Congress leader said his comments were misconstrued. "I don't view Congress as the big daddy," said Rahul at a Cambridge University event. "In no way is Congress superior to the other opposition parties. We're all fighting the same battle," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Rahul calls Indian Foreign Service 'arrogant', 'it's confidence', replies Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has responded to Rahul Gandhi's remarks calling Indian Foreign Service officers "arrogant". "Yes, the Indian Foreign Service has changed. Yes, they follow the orders of the Government. Yes, they counter the arguments of others. No, it's not called Arrogance. It is called Confidence," said Jaishankar. Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University in London.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Sidhu hasn't eaten in nearly 24 hours in jail due to wheat allergy: Lawyer
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who surrendered and was taken to Patiala Jail on Friday, hasn't eaten anything since then, his lawyer HPS Verma said today. The 58-year-old has been refusing prison food as he's allergic to wheat, Verma said. He added that a court appeal has been made to make food available to Sidhu as per his dietary constraints.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Hardik Patel's exit from Congress ungraceful: Jignesh Mevani
text: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani criticised Hardik Patel for resigning from Congress and said that his exit from the party was ungraceful as Congress party gave all the support to him. "You can have differences with the party. But it is inappropriate (for Patel) to say that the Congress is anti-Gujarat or anti-India," Mevani said. Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Took him so long to understand this?: Digvijaya on Jakhar's 'supremacy' remark
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised Sunil Jakhar over his "supremacy" remark against Congress and said, "So it took him so long to understand this?" Jakhar, who left Congress and joined BJP on Thursday, had said that supremacy in the Congress party lies with those who flatter high command adding that the Congress party has undergone "a huge change".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will follow court's order: Rajasthan Min on rape case against son
text: Speaking on accusation against son for raping 23-year-old woman, Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi said that the case is sub judice and they will follow court's orders. "Police are doing their job and so is the law. Law is same for everyone," he said. On May 8, Delhi Police filed a rape case against his son, Rohit, on the woman's complaint.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: TMC distributes food, umbrellas to people in flood-hit Agartala
text: The Trinamool Congress distributed umbrellas and food packets to the flood-hit people in Agartala. The food donation drive was led by Tripura TMC President Subal Bhowmik and state in-charge Rajib Banerjee. "Waterlogging has created havoc in several places in the North East," Bhowmik said, alleging that the BJP-led Tripura government "has done nothing" in four years to solve this crisis.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Had we come a year earlier in Goa, we might have done wonders: Azad
text: The Goa TMC announced an ad-hoc core committee of eight members on Thursday and during the announcement TMC Goa in-charge Kirti Azad said, "We are grateful to the people for allowing us to garner over 5 percent vote share." "Had we come a year earlier, we might have done wonders here. But then this is what it is," Azad added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bengal BJP leaders only interested in social media politics: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Arjun Singh said that he has informed BJP National President JP Nadda that West Bengal BJP leaders are only 'interested in social media politics and not doing ground-level work'. "Delhi is looking into the matter at its own level," he said. Singh added that BJP should give responsibility to those who are capable and deserve it.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Why is PM Modi reluctant to condemn riots?: Rajasthan CM
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot questioned why PM Narendra Modi was "reluctant" to condemn 'riots' taking place in various parts of the country, adding that the PM must condemn anti-social elements. Addressing the media on Rajiv Gandhi's death anniversary, Gehlot said, "Current government is vehement in forgetting the legacy of previous governments and former Prime Ministers."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP has spread kerosene all over the country: Rahul Gandhi
text: Addressing 'Ideas for India' conclave in London, Rahul Gandhi criticised BJP and said that the ruling party has spread kerosene all over the country, adding that only one spark could lead to a "big trouble". "India is not in a good place...I think it's also the responsibility of Opposition to bring people, communities, states and religions together," Gandhi said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: CBI officials misbehaved with Rabri Devi: RJD
text: After the CBI team raided Rabri Devi's residence in Patna for being accused in a corruption case, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) alleged that CBI officials "misbehaved" with Rabri Devi and used "unparliamentary language" during their interrogation. "We reiterate that the latest CBI case and the raids conducted across the country...are sponsored by BJP," RJD's spokesperson said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rahul Gandhi is neither scoring runs nor taking wickets: BJP's Raman Singh
text: BJP's Raman Singh said that Congress wants to make Rahul Gandhi a captain when he himself does not want to be one. "He is not ready to become a non-playing captain either. Rahul Gandhi is neither scoring runs nor taking wickets," Singh added. "After this 'Chintan Shivir', there will be no Congress government left in any state," Singh further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 2-day 'Chintan Shivir' to be held in Chandigarh by Haryana Cong
text: Congress' Haryana unit will be organising a two-day 'Chintan Shivir' in Chandigarh on May 31 and June 1. The meet will be held to implement the resolution in the state, passed in the recently concluded 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur. The decision to hold 'Chintan Shivir' was taken in a meeting chaired by Haryana Congress State President Udai Bhan on Friday.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Jharkhand to paint govt schools green, white; BJP criticises move
text: After the Jharkhand Education Project Council issued an order for government schools across the state to be painted in green and white shades, the BJP alleged that the move was politically motivated as the colours are associated with the state's ruling party JMM. However, state Education Minister Jagarnath Mahto told PTI that the colours were chosen based on "experts' recommendations".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Only 35% nullah cleaning work completed in Mumbai: BJP
text: BJP MLA Ashish Shelar criticised Mumbai's civic body BMC and claimed that only 35% of nullah cleaning work has been completed in the city. "The Shiv Sena-led BMC needs to explain why 65% of nullah cleaning work has remained incomplete. Who is responsible?" Shelar questioned. Shelar's statements came after he inspected the progress of nullah cleaning work on Thursday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Rahul left many issues unresolved at 'chintan shivir': Shiv Sena
text: An editorial published in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana' said that Congress' present condition is "miserable", which is not good for the country's democracy. It said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has left several issues unresolved at the party's recently concluded 'chintan shivir'. "This is why several leaders in different states are deserting the party," it added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Maha govt concerned about bar operators rather than farmers: Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government was more concerned about bar operators and reducing the prices of foreign liquor than solving problems faced by farmers. The MVA government has not given a penny to those affected by storms and heavy rains, the former Maharashtra CM said at a farmers' rally in Solapur.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Lalu Yadav, his family a symbol of corruption in Bihar: Sushil Modi
text: After CBI filed a 'land for railway job scam' case against Lalu Yadav, BJP leader Sushil Modi called Yadav and his family a symbol of corruption in Bihar. Modi claimed, "The modus operandi was...you give me land...I'll give [you] a Group D job in Railways. Here...land was first granted in someone else's name...after five-six years it was gifted to Yadav."
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Rajasthan has become a hub of crime: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore
text: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has claimed that Rajasthan has turned into a "hub of crime" under the Congress-run state government's regime. "On one side, Rajasthan tops in crime against women, on the other, it is at the lowest position in the implementation of welfare schemes," the MP from Jaipur Rural said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Don't replace Mahatma Gandhi's statue in Secunderabad: Cong appeals to GHMC
text: Telangana Congress leader Marri Shashidhar Reddy and other party leaders on Friday appealed to the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) not to replace Mahatma Gandhi's statue at James Street in Secunderabad. "It reminds us of Tughlaq's rule. Installing another statue in the same place is unfortunate, we are against it," Reddy said, adding that the statue has historical significance.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Rahul remembers father Rajiv on his death anniversary, calls him 'visionary'
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi remembered his late father and former PM Rajiv Gandhi on the latter's 31st death anniversary on Saturday. "My father was a visionary leader whose policies helped shape modern India," Rahul tweeted. "He was compassionate...and a wonderful father to me and Priyanka...I dearly miss him and fondly remember the time we spent together," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Nath praises BJP workers, says 'no one goes to tell them to work'
text: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Friday praised BJP workers, saying, "In the BJP, no one goes to tell the people on the ground that they have to go here or there and do so-and-so work." However, he added that Congress workers "wait for someone to tell them what to do". He further said that this was Congress' "only drawback".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Telangana CM KCR meets SP chief Akhilesh Yadav in New Delhi
text: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao met Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav at the former's official residence on the Tughlaq Road in New Delhi. "The two leaders discussed current national issues," an official statement said. Notably, Rao is in Delhi as part of his week-long tour to attend national-level political and social programmes, according to a report.
author: Shailesh

headlines: What he said is true: Raut on Rahul's 'kerosene' remark against BJP
text: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP has spread kerosene all over the country and only one spark could create a big trouble, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said, "What he said is true". Raut said, "We have said the same thing in different words. It's like strangulating the country's democracy with the help of central probe agencies."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: CBI files FIR against WB Minister Adhikary, daughter over teacher appointment scam
text: CBI has registered an FIR against West Bengal Minister of State for School Education PC Adhikary and his daughter for failing to appear before it at the set time. Calcutta High Court had directed CBI to interrogate them over alleged appointment of his daughter as a teacher in a state government-aided school. Adhikary had mailed to CBI seeking more time.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Thoko Tali!: Amarinder's party tweets after Sidhu gets 1-year jail
text: After Supreme Court sentenced Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a 1988 road rage case, his former party colleague Captain Amarinder Singh's Punjab Lok Congress tweeted, "Thoko Tali! (clap your hands)." It is Sidhu's famous dialogue from a television comedy show. The SC had spared Sidhu a jail term in 2018.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Right man in right party: Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder as Jakhar joins BJP
text: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Thursday congratulated ex-Congress leader Sunil Jakhar for joining the BJP. "Right man in the right party," said Singh, who quit Congress and formed his own party last year. He added, "Honest and upright leaders like him [Jakhar] cannot breathe in the Congress anymore."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: TN Cong protest over Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
text: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee on Thursday held silent protests in parts of the state over the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in late PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. Party workers covered their mouths with a white cloth during the protests. Congress should "withdraw its support to DMK government" over the issue, state BJP chief K Annamalai said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: CPI holds protest against arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad
text: The Communist Party of India (CPI) protested against the arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad. "After the Telangana government was formed they are trying to sabotage everything by using police power and filing false cases and sending people to jail," CPI state secretary said. Viswam was arrested after he allegedly staged a protest while demanding houses for the poor.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP sees reflection of Indian culture in every regional language: PM Modi
text: Speaking on the controversies around making Hindi as the national language, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "BJP sees a reflection of Indian culture in every regional language and considers them worth worshipping." "In past few days, we have seen that attempts are being made to spark controversies...We have given importance to every regional language in NEP," the PM added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: He is drunk in appeasement politics: Maurya on Akhilesh's remark on temples
text: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said that he is drunk in "appeasement politics". "Akhilesh Yadav ji has forgotten the essence of 'sanatan' Hinduism," Maurya added. Earlier, Akhilesh said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong workers hold cylinders, protest against inflation in Kolkata
text: Congress protested against inflation in Kolkata, where protesters held cylinders and raised slogans against the Central and state government. "The Union government has increased excise duty on petroleum products and the state govt has imposed VAT on these products," West Bengal Congress Chief Adhir Chowdhury said. This comes after LPG prices were increased for the second time this month.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: PM must defend nation: Rahul on China building bridge in Ladakh
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday reacted to reports of China building a second bridge on Pangong Tso lake in Ladakh, saying, "India's national security and territorial integrity [are] non-negotiable...[PM Narendra Modi] must defend the nation." This comes after Ministry of External Affairs said that it's "closely" monitoring the situation. "A timid and docile response won't do," Rahul added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP is using him: Raut on Raj Thackeray's postponed Ayodhya visit
text: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray postponed his proposed visit to Ayodhya, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut alleged that the "BJP is using the MNS chief" for political gain. Raut said, "I got to know from the media that...(MNS) cancelled some programs in Ayodhya. We would have supported them (MNS)...After all, there's a huge section of Shiv Sena supporters in Ayodhya."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: India achieving new heights under PM Modi: Yogi Adityanath
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that India has been moving towards new heights in the last eight years, adding that the country only crawled for 70 years. Speaking at Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav program, he said, "This is the first time after independence that the country is taking forward (development) programs under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: No Maoists in Jhargram: Mamata as she warns against 'fake news'
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said there were no Maoists in Jhargram and warned of strict action against those spreading "fake news". "Around 1,000 people who were active Maoists, surrendered and have been employed as home guards or in the police force," Mamata said. She also criticised the BJP government and alleged they were harassing TMC through central agencies.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: SC gave justice: Azam Khan's son on his father's bail order
text: After the Supreme Court granted interim bail to SP leader Azam Khan, his son Abdullah Azam Khan said, "Supreme Court delivered justice." "I am very happy (with SC's order). Will go to Rampur directly (after the release)," said Adeeb Azam Khan. The SC granted bail to Azam Khan two days after UP government urged the court to deny the same.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP has encroached on government land in Delhi: AAP
text: AAP on Thursday released a list of BJP leaders accusing them of encroaching on government land in Delhi and asked when the party would run bulldozers over their illegal construction. "We've photographic evidence of residences of BJP leaders...which clearly shows encroachment, illegal occupation of government land and unauthorised constructions," said Saurabh Bharadwaj, Chief Spokesperson, AAP.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Told Rahul to expel Sidhu, Jakhar but he didn't listen: Sukhjinder Randhawa
text: Congress leader and former Deputy CM of Punjab Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa on Thursday claimed that he had told the Congress leadership, including Rahul Gandhi, in February to expel both Navjot Singh Sidhu and Sunil Jakhar from the party. However, Rahul Gandhi did not listen to him, Randhawa said. "What Congress couldn't do, Supreme Court has done today," Randhawa added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Raj Thackeray postpones Ayodhya visit amid protests by BJP leaders
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray on Friday took to Twitter to inform that he has temporarily postponed his proposed visit to UP's Ayodhya on June 5. The decision comes amid protests by certain BJP leaders and activists against his visit to Ayodhya. The BJP leaders were demanding Thackeray's unconditional apology for his remarks made against North Indians in 2008.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP holding meeting as it's scared after Cong's 'Chintan Shivir': Gehlot
text: Ahead of BJP's high-level meeting in Jaipur, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said the party is holding the conclave as it's scared after the Congress organised its 'Chintan Shivir'. "They are scared...therefore they are coming here," Gehlot said. He further criticised the saffron party for its agenda of Hindutva, saying BJP is doing politics in the name of Hindus.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Have not yet taken a decision on joining BJP or AAP: Hardik Patel
text: After resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said that he has not yet taken a decision on joining any other political party, be it BJP or AAP. Addressing a press conference, Hardik Patel criticised Congress, saying leaders of the party were biased against the people of Gujarat. "I wasted my three years in this party," Patel said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP running 'Tughlaqi Raj', no one has right to freedom: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP and said that the party is running 'Tughlaqi Raj' in the country. Praising her party, she said that unlike BJP, TMC is a party of "Maa Maati Manush". "They are running 'Tughlaqi Kand' through...central agency. No one has the right to freedom, BJP has ended all rights," Mamata said in Jhargram district.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Attempt to muzzle a strong voice: RJD as CBI raids places linked to Lalu
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Alok Mehta criticised the raids conducted by CBI at multiple locations linked to former Bihar Chief Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav. "This is an attempt to muzzle a strong voice. CBI's...actions are completely biased," Mehta said. Opposing the raids, Lalu's brother Prabhunath Yadav said, "It's unfortunate that a person who is ill is being deliberately troubled."
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Jakhar started working for BJP long before joining it: Punjab Cong chief
text: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja criticised Sunil Jakhar for leaving Congress and joining BJP and said that Jakhar's move was "not unexpected" as he had been working for the party long before joining it. Jakhar was doing "Hindutva politics"  and the reason for doing so is revealed now, Raja added. Jakhar was damaging Congress in every way, Raja said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: You can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time: Hardik Patel to Congress
text: Patidar leader Hardik Patel on Thursday criticised the Congress for purportedly "taking out anger" over PM Narendra Modi being from Gujarat on businessmen like Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. "A businessman rises due to his or her own hard work. [Congress] can't abuse Adani or Ambani every time," he added. This comes after Patel resigned from the Congress on Wednesday.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Hardik Patel quit Congress fearing jail in sedition cases: Jagdish Thakor
text: After Hardik Patel resigned from Congress on Wednesday, the party's Gujarat chief Jagdish Thakor claimed, "Hardik feared that he may have to go to jail in sedition cases if he stays in the Congress." "Hence, to save himself from the possible punishment, he decided to quit the Congress and he might join the BJP as well," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Cong's 'Chintan Shivir' failed to achieve anything meaningful: Kishor
text: Election strategist Prashant Kishor said that Congress' 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur only helped in "prolonging the status-quo" and "it failed to achieve anything meaningful". Earlier, Kishor was in talks with the Congress leadership to work for the revival of the party but later he declined the offer saying, "I couldn't have added anything to Congress."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Punjab CM Mann meets Amit Shah in Delhi, discusses border security
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Thursday and discussed issues, including national security concerns and technology infrastructure needed to enhance border management.
